commit_message:
Fix wrong section used for some volume driver options

Since cinder removed support for a single backend[1], volume backends
no longer load parameters from [DEFAULT] section, and the different
[backend_defaults] section is used as a common place where default
overrides are defined.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/453654

Change-Id: I298a85e0216fa2ec655f2d6250f9c1ba45d71b97
Closes-Bug: #1939956

The case that those constant steps are affecting is massive port handling: either agent restart, or large amount of ports being added at the same time (> step size). The traceback form bug description looks more like single port update. My guess is that Neutron servers (or DB) are overloaded with a lot of requests from all OVS agents - that's the reason for RPC timeouts. Not sure I see how agent step size could help with it. Could you please clarify?"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-07-29 09:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-07-29 11:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

There was a work did same thing before:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/765072

But, we are going to make it automatic adjustment.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-07-29 11:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-07-29 11:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-07-29 12:38:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-07-30 01:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

So, IMO, the bug is just a mis-configration. This change is not needed anymore.'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)

I confirm that we have increased all config timeout options - it does not help.
The goal of the patch is to give an option to tune step sizes.
By default neutron behavior is not changed.
I see your wish to automate step calculation.
My proposal is to accept this patch with default hard-coded values which were before.
In future default hard-coded values will be replaced by some automatic calculation, but config option to set these values will be in place.
So user will be able to set values by himself/herself or values will be calculated by the neutron.
Please share your final decision.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-07-30 10:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

My last question was not answered: please clarify if traceback from bug description is single port update, or is it agent restart/massive port update case?'}, {'account_id': 32927, 'date': '2021-07-30 11:31:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

>

commit_message:
Agent RPC step size in config.

Number of resources for neutron to divide
the large RPC call data sets always equals 100.
In "big" networks even these numbers can be
still huge and cause service timeouts.
Now we can decrease these numbers in config.
Default value equals 20 now.

Closes-Bug: 1938202
Change-Id: Idf545ad31398ded460b6c2ae1675dd5e9ae71440

commit_message:
Include ironic/tests in irrelevant-files

Since we run inspector jobs in ironic gate, we need to
include `ironic/tests` in the irrelevant-files so
we don't run the jobs when there is only changes in unit tests.

Change-Id: I98757ab78716689355f70c7735480d4dc8e04320

subject: Add an action to provide information about AZ
messages:
[{'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-02 10:14:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-02 10:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Example action output:
```bash
  ceph-osd git:(bug1911006) juju run-action --wait ceph-osd/1 get-availability-zone
unit-ceph-osd-1:
  UnitId: ceph-osd/1
  id: "62"
  results:
    per-host: "True"
    rack: None
    row: None
  status: completed
  timing:
    completed: 2021-03-02 10:18:10 +0000 UTC
    enqueued: 2021-03-02 10:18:09 +0000 UTC
    started: 2021-03-02 10:18:10 +0000 UTC
  ceph-osd git:(bug1911006) juju config ceph-osd  customize-failure-domain=true
  ceph-osd git:(bug1911006) juju run-action --wait ceph-osd/1 get-availability-zone
unit-ceph-osd-1:
  UnitId: ceph-osd/1
  id: "64"
  results:
    per-host: "False"
    rack: nova
    row: None
  status: completed
  timing:
    completed: 2021-03-02 10:18:56 +0000 UTC
    enqueued: 2021-03-02 10:18:55 +0000 UTC
    started: 2021-03-02 10:18:56 +0000 UTC
```'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2021-03-10 15:53:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Per discussion with Robert, the returned keymap will change its names (e.g. "per-host" may be renamed to "replication-type").

However, I wanted to share what the current action looks like when Juju is backed by MAAS and "zones" (or AZs) and "rows" (via the "availability_zone" Juju config parameter) are in play:
https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/3qTRqmTv6c/

Change lgtm (cosmetic changes in progress)'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-10 17:38:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-03-10 22:16:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

While this returns the juju configured value for the OSD locations, I wonder if its not also valuable to query the ceph cluster to determine what it thinks is the actual OSD location. If the user is going to use this information for determining whether or not an OSD can safely be removed/taken down then it may be best to use the authoritative data.

In theory, the ceph cluster and the information contained by the charm should always agree - however, there are actions that an administrator might have taken which causes the charm and the cluster to disagree, which means the information provided may be misleading.

The authoritative results of OSDs for the unit come from the Ceph cluster's crush map, and can be queried via `ceph osd find <foo>`."}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-11 16:34:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> While this returns the juju configured value for the OSD locations, I wonder if its not also valuable to query the ceph cluster to determine what it thinks is the actual OSD location. If the user is going to use this information for determining whether or not an OSD can safely be removed/taken down then it may be best to use the authoritative data.
> 
> In theory, the ceph cluster and the information contained by the charm should always agree - however, there are actions that an administrator might have taken which causes the charm and the cluster to disagree, which means the information provided may be misleading.
> 
> The authoritative results of OSDs for the unit come from the Ceph cluster's crush map, and can be queried via `ceph osd find <foo>`.

I tried `ceph osd find <osd-id>`/`ceph osd tree` and I got `auth: unable to find a keyring ...`

Then I tried to use `--id osd-upgrade`, which helped me get the output of `ceph osd tree` but not `ceph osd find <osd-id>` (I got `ERROR no relation id specified\nError EACCES: access denied `).

Also I tried to use the `create_keyrings` function to create admin keyring, but then I realized that this is a function for ceph-mon.

Any suggestion which keyring should I use?"}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-12 15:26:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> While this returns the juju configured value for the OSD locations, I wonder if its not also valuable to query the ceph cluster to determine what it thinks is the actual OSD location. If the user is going to use this information for determining whether or not an OSD can safely be removed/taken down then it may be best to use the authoritative data.
> 
> In theory, the ceph cluster and the information contained by the charm should always agree - however, there are actions that an administrator might have taken which causes the charm and the cluster to disagree, which means the information provided may be misleading.
> 
> The authoritative results of OSDs for the unit come from the Ceph cluster's crush map, and can be queried via `ceph osd find <foo>`.

For bug [2] I proposed a review [1]. If these changes are approved, I will use the get_osd_tree function and get information from list of CrushLocation.

---
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.ceph/+/780280
[2]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-ceph-osd/+bug/1918721"}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 13:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 13:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

This needs to be tested after solving the bug1918721 [1] (I suggested a fix [2]).

---
[1]: https://launchpad.net/bugs/1918721
[2]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.ceph/+/780280'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 15:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 15:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Output example: https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/J9dGJcFnY7/'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 16:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-03-15 16:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Output example: https://pastebin.ubuntu.com/p/ZVYTnhbcgy/'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-05-17 11:21:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Workflow

This review depends on [1], as it needs to use a fixed output from `get_osd_tree`.
---
[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charms.ceph/+/780280'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2021-06-08 07:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I like the concept of giving more tools to tools to manage Juju things, but actions should also support human friendly output formats'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-06-08 16:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32363, 'date': '2021-06-08 16:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add an action to provide information about AZ

The 'get-availability-zone' action will get information about an
availability zone that will contain information about the CRUSH
structure. Specifically 'rack' and 'row'.

Closes-Bug: #1911006
Change-Id: I99ebbef5f23d6efe3c848b089c7f2b0d26ad0077

commit_message:
Add support for direct ports with QoS in OVN driver

As we extended before the OVS QoS driver with direct ports, see here [1],
we need to do the same with OVN driver
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/611605
We started to support this in rhel-osp 16, so we added the minimun
version of ovs and ovn as in rhel-osp 16, OVS 2.13.4 and
OVN 2.13-20.12.0-85

Closes-Bug: #1935764
Change-Id: Ia9d12aa7195383bce744381d4ed4620bb115d4b9

subject: nova-common: support keystone_authtoken.memcache_security_strategy
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 10:31:01.000000000', 'message': 'nova-common: support keystone_authtoken.memcache_security_strategy

By default auth tokens are passed to memcached as-is, which makes them
both readable to other users of the same memcached servers and
susceptible to tampering. Make it possible for the user to make this
more secure, with the required secret key retrieved using
get_password().

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: I97113db5a12c3e939652d8949e890581074b1917
'}]
commit_message:
nova-common: support keystone_authtoken.memcache_security_strategy

By default auth tokens are passed to memcached as-is, which makes them
both readable to other users of the same memcached servers and
susceptible to tampering. Make it possible for the user to make this
more secure, with the required secret key retrieved using
get_password().

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: I97113db5a12c3e939652d8949e890581074b1917

subject: Allow override of rabbitmq config in kolla toolbox
messages:
[{'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2021-04-09 10:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2021-04-12 15:20:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maybe a bit of background on our use case is helpful.
We modify rabbitmq's erl_inetrc to define host entries for each cluster node. This way we do not rely on the server's /etc/hosts which is modified in a different step in the deployment.
As of now this leads to a failure in task service-rabbitmq, because these entries do not exist in the erl_inetrc of rabbitmqctl in kolla-toolbox.
This commit would allow us to define the same host entries for all involved containers."}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2021-04-14 13:45:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 30911, 'date': '2021-04-14 14:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This change is nice. Let me finish it with a releasenote that is missing now.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:29:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

meh, actually it exposes a bug with missing conditional for rabbitmq, let me fix that first...'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:57:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-08-13 12:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27339, 'date': '2021-08-31 07:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}]

commit_message:
Allow override of rabbitmq config in kolla toolbox

Certain overrides for rabbitmq may need to be set for `rabbitmqctl` in
kolla-toolbox aswell.
This commit allows to override `rabbitmq-env.conf` and `erl_inetrc` in
kolla-toolbox.

Change-Id: Idef6adcf9700f75a2db503444a8de093ee21a9c5

messages: [{'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-02 09:42:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-02 09:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14200, 'date': '2021-09-02 10:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-07 08:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 09:42:38.000000000', 'message': "Correctly configure S3 Token Middleware for Swift

According the documentation [1] there need to configure auth_uri in the
[filter:s3token] section instead of www_authenticate_uri which cause an
error 'swift.common.wsgi.ConfigFileError: Invalid auth_uri; must
include scheme and host' during start the swift-proxy-server container.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/swift/ussuri/middleware.html#s3-token-middleware

Change-Id: I6b8f5807ebb746428a501dca13eae30763dede8d
Closes-Bug: 1862765
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 835920782fb48c4a750814fedd04126424334856)
(cherry picked from commit a473d35e04a7e1d18a722fdb2b06176f217d7812)
"}]
commit_message:
Correctly configure S3 Token Middleware for Swift

According the documentation [1] there need to configure auth_uri in the
[filter:s3token] section instead of www_authenticate_uri which cause an
error 'swift.common.wsgi.ConfigFileError: Invalid auth_uri; must
include scheme and host' during start the swift-proxy-server container.

1. https://docs.openstack.org/swift/ussuri/middleware.html#s3-token-middleware

Change-Id: I6b8f5807ebb746428a501dca13eae30763dede8d
Closes-Bug: 1862765
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 835920782fb48c4a750814fedd04126424334856)
(cherry picked from commit a473d35e04a7e1d18a722fdb2b06176f217d7812)

messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-09-03 12:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-09-03 13:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Without this patch, I am hitting issue as mentioned in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1938618/.

Tested locally with this patch "overcloud delete" is working.

It tried heat stack delete and failed to reach heat endpoint and post a traceback on console.. but because of a rescue block overcloud delete is completing successfully

~~~
msg": "The Heat stack for \"overcloud\" was not deleted, depending on the deployment type this may be normal."
~~~

I observed a similar message as:-

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1938618/comments/2

if we don't try to delete heat stack/ don't show traceback in console in Ephermal Heat case that would be ideal imho, but this look okay to me. We can do the further improvements in a separate patch if needed.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-07 07:30:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Update stack delete to support local stacks

This change will ensure that the stack delete playbook can support and
cleanup stacks that are not specifically running within a legacy Heat
environment.

Tasks were added to cleanup the config-download path and the
tripleo-deploy path within the users home folder (default locations).

Change-Id: I616d8b8a87c3a51aa17230a718d206d2326fe50d
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit f8f12c4f335679dbf266e7a8f93f161201261e13)

subject: server: run neutron-api under Apache
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 09:59:33.000000000', 'message': 'server: run neutron-api under Apache

According to
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/wallaby/admin/config-wsgi.html
it is entirely okay to have Apache handle the Neutron API. Do so,
it makes it easier to both keep services under control and change
SSL settings.

Strongly inspired by implementation of same in openstack-block-storage
and openstack-compute. First iteration, without test updates.

PS. Prior to this change this cookbook did NOT in fact properly manage
Neutron on modern Debian - it appears to assume running as an old-style,
monolithic server yet at least Buster only provides scripts for running
neutron-api as a standalone UWSGI app + neutron-rpc-server separately.
This means that those services only ran because dpkg told them to
at install time.

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: I02f777956adb332185a6e47a32e253970293edc4
'}]
commit_message:
server: run neutron-api under Apache

According to
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/wallaby/admin/config-wsgi.html
it is entirely okay to have Apache handle the Neutron API. Do so,
it makes it easier to both keep services under control and change
SSL settings.

Strongly inspired by implementation of same in openstack-block-storage
and openstack-compute. First iteration, without test updates.

PS. Prior to this change this cookbook did NOT in fact properly manage
Neutron on modern Debian - it appears to assume running as an old-style,
monolithic server yet at least Buster only provides scripts for running
neutron-api as a standalone UWSGI app + neutron-rpc-server separately.
This means that those services only ran because dpkg told them to
at install time.

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: I02f777956adb332185a6e47a32e253970293edc4

commit_message:
Do not create mysql user if it already exists

Mariadb 10.5 creates a user mysql@localhost when the
db is initialized. When bootstrapping the db on the
undercloud, do not try to recreate this user if it
already exists.

Change-Id: Ifde49bfb958252cba3d57a7d9e4f51690fec2ec2
Closes-Bug: #1942772

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing

We facing errors related to the new pip resolver, this
topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

I propose to drop this test because the complexity and recurring pain needed
to maintain that now exceeds the benefits provided by this mechanismes.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html

Change-Id: I1e0c8e173a1197e54ba4f8a3eacdc2dcd567dfc9

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Closes-Bug: #1936667
Change-Id: Iafc013cb9b454bc5251d126643f68f3112dafa54

No additional fix in this patch will do fix in patch "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" if this patch merged before "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" patch.

As in "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" patch new function "_update_hot_available_scale" has added and considering scale group by adding "_group" which is conflicting with this patch.

So I haved added comment in "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" to fix this in that patch itself.'}, {'account_id': 31072, 'date': '2021-08-02 10:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

>

> 
> As in "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" patch new function "_update_hot_available_scale" has added and considering scale group by adding "_group" which is conflicting with this patch.
> 
> So I haved added comment in "https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/787711" to fix this in that patch itself.

I understood. LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2021-08-24 01:54:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 31857, 'date': '2021-08-31 13:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Remove the restriction of scaling group name

This patch will fix the issue about naming limitation
for scale group.

Closes-Bug: #1924208
Change-Id: I2e4edbc5804b2c35075361dec1296334bf933ace

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Add storage assisted migration support

This patch adds support for storage assisted migration
(intra-cluster) to NetApp ONTAP drivers (iSCSI/FC/NFS), for the
following use cases:

1) Between pools in a same vserver and  backend/stanza. This
operation is non-disruptive on iSCSI and FC drivers.
2) Between pools in a same vserver but in a different
backend/stanza. This operation is disruptive in all cases
and requires the volume to be in `available` status.
3) Between pools in a different vserver in a different
backend/stanza. This operation is disruptive in all cases
and requires the volume to be in `available` status.

Storage assisted migration is only supported within the same
ONTAP cluster. If a migration between two different clusters is
requested, driver will automatically fallback to host assisted
migration.

Implements: blueprint ontap-storage-assisted-migration
Change-Id: Iaad87c80ae37b6c0fc5f788dc56f1f72c0ca07fa

commit_message:
[Part2] Remove six

We don't need this in a Python 3-only world.

Remove six in follows:
1. zaqar/storage/mongodb/catalogue.py
2. zaqar/storage/mongodb/flavors.py
3. zaqar/storage/mongodb/pools.py
4. zaqar/storage/mongodb/subscriptions.py
5. zaqar/storage/mongodb/utils.py
6. zaqar/storage/pooling.py
7. zaqar/storage/redis/catalogue.py
8. zaqar/storage/redis/driver.py
9. zaqar/storage/redis/pools.py
10. zaqar/storage/redis/subscriptions.py
11. zaqar/storage/redis/utils.py
12. zaqar/storage/swift/driver.py

revisions:

commit_message:
Add support for OVN NB Logical_Router_Policy table

Policy-based routing was introduced in OVN to configure permit/deny
and reroute policies on the router. As part of this change a new table
is added in the northbound schema called "Logical_Router_Policy". Each
row in this table represents a policy of a logical router.

This change adds functions and commands to add, delete and list rows
of this table.

Change-Id: If4b41e7ef00c3e97fcd0b8cc4f60ae348a93ffb0
Signed-off-by: Abhiram Sangana <sangana.abhiram@nutanix.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-03 14:11:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't use singleton in routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware

It seems that using default singleton=True in the
routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware which is leading to use thread-local
RequestConfig singleton object is not working well with eventlet
monkeypatching of threading library which we are doing in Neutron.
As a result it leaks memory in neutron-api workers every time when API
request to not existing API endpoint is made by user.

To avoid that memory leak, let's use singletone=False in that
RoutesMiddleware object, at least until problem with thread-local
singleton and eventlet monkey patching will be solved.

Closes-Bug: #1942179
Change-Id: Id3a529248d3984506f0166bdc32e334127a01b7b
"}, {'created': '2021-09-04 09:25:27.000000000', 'message': "Don't use singleton in routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware

It seems that using default singleton=True in the
routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware which is leading to use thread-local
RequestConfig singleton object is not working well with eventlet
monkeypatching of threading library which we are doing in Neutron.
As a result it leaks memory in neutron-api workers every time when API
request to not existing API endpoint is made by user.

To avoid that memory leak, let's use singletone=False in that
RoutesMiddleware object, at least until problem with thread-local
singleton and eventlet monkey patching will be solved.

Closes-Bug: #1942179
Change-Id: Id3a529248d3984506f0166bdc32e334127a01b7b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use singleton in routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware

It seems that using default singleton=True in the
routes.middleware.RoutesMiddleware which is leading to use thread-local
RequestConfig singleton object is not working well with eventlet
monkeypatching of threading library which we are doing in Neutron.
As a result it leaks memory in neutron-api workers every time when API
request to not existing API endpoint is made by user.

To avoid that memory leak, let's use singletone=False in that
RoutesMiddleware object, at least until problem with thread-local
singleton and eventlet monkey patching will be solved.

Closes-Bug: #1942179
Change-Id: Id3a529248d3984506f0166bdc32e334127a01b7b

commit_message:
Modify the rbac_role to make secrets accessible

In the process of secondary development, we found
that we often need to access secrets from pod.
However, it seems that helm-tookit does not support
adding resource of secrets to role. This commit
try to fix that.

Change-Id: If384d6ccb7672a8da5a5e1403733fa655dfe40dd

[{'created': '2021-08-26 12:23:39.000000000', 'message': 'Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.

Change-Id: If95d39b46374ef504ded0d086a339b303f4fa7c6
'}, {'created': '2021-08-27 06:10:30.000000000', 'message': 'Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by

commit_message:
Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.

Change-Id: If95d39b46374ef504ded0d086a339b303f4fa7c6

commit_message:
Use a 'params' hash for authtoken parameters

This change adds the 'params' hash in authtoken class, to implement
the same functionality as the one recently introduced into
puppet-nova[1].

[1] 5c38281e1b698f157f03bf1815733277c541c30b

Change-Id: Iae359ee38cac10190f9813b14cd3a2f92a59d1b6

subject: Add toleration to CSI nodeplugin
messages:
[{'account_id': 33268, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:08:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:16:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Backport-Candidate+2 Code-Review+2

Nice catch, ideally we'd like to start using Cinder CSI chart itself but this will do for now."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If you can, a story and a task would be handy for backporting.'}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:20:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 33268, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:20:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> If you can, a story and a task would be handy for backporting.

Can do, though it will take me a short while as I'm still getting used to Opendev.

Do you want the story to just be similar to the task, i.e. just adding the tolerations for tainted nodes, or something else?"}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2021-03-23 14:26:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Add toleration to CSI nodeplugin

This commit allows the CSI nodeplugin to start on machines with taints.
A use case is nodegroups; a dedicated machine (e.g. ASICs and GPU) will
join the cluster with a pre-defined taint so that pods can't grab
valuable resources. However the taint currently stops the node from
starting the plugin and getting a node ID, so we cannot use cinder
volumes within pods.

This commit ports the work done by jichenjc
(https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/pull/1276) into
Magnum fixing the issue here too.

Story: 2007048
Task: 42097

Change-Id: I8dec787660604d52156d71617d2bdda73fb62e9c

commit_message:
[k8s] Fix CA rotate

Using admin.conf as the kubeconfig to get correct permissions
to run kubectl command to update pods to use the new CA certs.
Besides, now we need to create client certs on master nodes
as well.

Story:2008858
Task: 42379

Change-Id: I4996060dd18ef3c448d4b225caec53bf0ae0ba75

commit_message:
Replace the 'try except' block

The goal is to avoid the error
```
Attribute [] not found in [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7fc649c52520>]: ''.
```
in debug messages when the field `_alternate_id` is empty

Change-Id: I70dc26ff161227ea1d65d935a743dc6f6d3485ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-06 15:07:47.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Refactor agent mixins, decompose AgentDeployMixin

Currently we have 4 mixins in agent_base.py, as well as CustomAgentDeploy
in agent.py. Even I have a hard time understanding which is designed for
what. I think AgentDeployMixin was required for iSCSI deploy, which has
already been removed, so let's decompose it.

The result is a clearer inheritence chain:
HeartbeatMixin - AgentBaseMixin - CustomAgentDeploy - AgentDeploy
AgentOobStepsMixin -------------/

The old content of AgentDeployMixin has been split between
CustomAgentDeploy (the deploy steps machinery) and AgentDeploy
(boot device handling).

Change-Id: I53e2b30823f88c80c21bce6388f9f9e8d6ea9aad
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Refactor agent mixins, decompose AgentDeployMixin

Currently we have 4 mixins in agent_base.py, as well as CustomAgentDeploy
in agent.py. Even I have a hard time understanding which is designed for
what. I think AgentDeployMixin was required for iSCSI deploy, which has
already been removed, so let's decompose it.

The result is a clearer inheritence chain:
HeartbeatMixin - AgentBaseMixin - CustomAgentDeploy - AgentDeploy
AgentOobStepsMixin -------------/

The old content of AgentDeployMixin has been split between
CustomAgentDeploy (the deploy steps machinery) and AgentDeploy
(boot device handling).

Change-Id: I53e2b30823f88c80c21bce6388f9f9e8d6ea9aad

forwards and backwards

Change-Id: Ic215719e52ef1cc8a7a99bafe5d7393f583cc7b7
"}, {'created': '2021-09-03 12:33:42.000000000', 'message': "Make sure we test for Promoted when looking for constraints

pacemaker 2.1 returns 'Promoted' as opposed to 'Master' in its
with-rsc-role output. Let's test for both of them to keep compatibility
forwards and backwards. See: https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pacemaker/commit/c3b7b13ef
for example.

commit_message:
Make sure we test for Promoted when looking for constraints

pacemaker 2.1 returns 'Promoted' as opposed to 'Master' in its
with-rsc-role output. Let's test for both of them to keep compatibility
forwards and backwards. See: https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pacemaker/commit/c3b7b13ef
for example.

Tested this on Centos9 and fixed the issue with puppet not detecting
that a constraint was already there.

Change-Id: Ic215719e52ef1cc8a7a99bafe5d7393f583cc7b7

(24 comments)

Thanks Kafilat - I've suggested changes inline - we're exposing one kind of scheduler stat here, storage pools - so this needs a rewrite to accommodate that - here's an example from cinder which has a similar concept: https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/master/openstack/block_storage/v3/stats.py

commit_message:
Move build_extra_template before upgrade prepare

build_extra_template.yaml specifies config_heat_extra_yaml fact which is
used in overcloud_upgrade_prepare.sh.j2. This patch moves it before
upgrade prepare to render upgrade prepare script properly.

Change-Id: I4b6d2d7345c9ad8f84a26909eb7ad350fe4e35a5
(cherry picked from commit 0ee1f0dcf05581b3a43d539a0625a4f2b8f50c36)

For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-08-30 15:09:02.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: ironic-week-prio'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-08-30 15:23:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is a wrong place to retry IMO. We already have retries in ipmitool, let's figure out why they don't work for you."}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-09-01 06:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> This is a wrong place to retry IMO. We already have retries in ipmitool, let's figure out why they don't work for you.

Thanks for checking, Dmitry.

I think do not work since they rely on the actual command to fail (and the corresponding exception). From what I see, this is not the case: it "succeeds" but returns nothing (which is translated to "error").

This is also maybe why we have explicit retries in https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/src/branch/master/ironic/conductor/manager.py#L3579-L3599 for power sync.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-09-01 11:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> From what I see, this is not the case: it "succeeds" but returns nothing (which is translated to "error")

Mmm, we should return an error on that and retry. I guess nobody simply realized that it's possible.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-09-01 12:45:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > From what I see, this is not the case: it "succeeds" but returns nothing (which is translated to "error")
> 
> Mmm, we should return an error on that and retry. I guess nobody simply realized that it's possible.

On hold for now. Looking into the ipmitool code, it seems like:
- ipmitool will return EXIT_FAILURE in case it does not print anything
- this should indeed trigger the retries in ipmitool.py Dmitry is mentioning
- we do not see this in our deployment as we have a cipher negotiation wrapper which seems to swallow the ipmitool return code (which skips the exception and therefore the internal retries ...)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-09-02 11:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag removed: ironic-week-prio'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2021-09-06 16:28:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

not needed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-20 08:12:29.000000000', 'message': 'Retry getting the power state of a node in fast-track mode

If Ironic is unable to get the power state in fast-track
mode, retry once before giving up.

Also: disentangle the conditions under which fast-track is
calculated to be false and add some debugging to make
the reasoning easier to understand.

Story: #2009063
Task: #42863

Change-Id: I8f67ddc694857ac637ae892e4a678a61a6b8fdd2
'}]
commit_message:
Retry getting the power state of a node in fast-track mode

If Ironic is unable to get the power state in fast-track
mode, retry once before giving up.

Also: disentangle the conditions under which fast-track is
calculated to be false and add some debugging to make
the reasoning easier to understand.

Story: #2009063
Task: #42863

Change-Id: I8f67ddc694857ac637ae892e4a678a61a6b8fdd2

I've done a quick look at the patch, and I think we need finer grained error messages to provide the best value for the cloud users.

For example, we should emit messages inside the "_run_backup" when the attach or detach fails, as well as when the cleanup fails.

We should also emit messages on the volume manager when "get_backup_device" fails.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2021-06-07 11:22:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2021-06-07 12:16:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

commit_message:
Add user messages for backup operations

This patch adds user messages for the following backup operations:
1) Create backup
2) Restore backup
3) Delete Backup

Change-Id: Idc00b125b33bf9abd2e2057d9cee25a337e6d418

commit_message:
Set force_granularity: 300 in metrics.yml

It appears that the default metrics.yml needs force_granularity: 300
otherwise cloudkitty-processor will fail to process metrics from
Gnocchi. As this is what at least I (in Debian) ship in packages, it
would be nice to have a working default.

Change-Id: I28b43d6131182252c0576d9323bbcdbfb1dbbd0a
Story: 2008598
Task: 41771

commit_message:
Relase osc-placement

The recently release 3.1.0 had a critical bug so we are releasing 3.1.1
for Xena.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 3.1.0..HEAD
0ea8f1b Fix allocation show / unset with empty allocation
087dd64 Repro allocation show bug with empty allocation

Change-Id: I31b8a0d0a85e7e8cd0e38ea671af94a703284025

commit_message:
Fix notify listener syntax for SEGMENT_HOST_MAPPING

Change auto_schedule_new_network_segments call to use old notification
listener syntax in old stable branches of Neutron that still use
notify instead of publish.
Fix only needed for stable/stein, stable/rocky, stable/queens

Closes-Bug: #1939125
Change-Id: I99a50725a514b324d3f886db9fd2d3dd37efd031
(cherry picked from commit 7f63139424adcbbc18cdbf1b0fa3efa3b0fd3f45)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 14:10:10.000000000', 'message': 'api: Reject volume attach requests when an active bdm exists

When attaching volumes to instances Nova has previously relied on checks
carried out by c-api to ensure that a single non-multiattach volume is
not attached to multiple instances at once. While this works well in
most cases it does not handle PEBKAC issues when admins reset the state
of a volume to available, allowing users to request that Nova attach the
volume to another instance.

This change aims to address this by including a simple check in the
attach flow for non-multiattach volumes ensuring that there are no
existing active block device mapping records for the volume already
present within Nova.

Closes-Bug: #1908075
Change-Id: I2881d77d52bcbde9f3ac6a6ddfb4a22a9bd45c8a
(cherry picked from commit 1252588d4e48da1d3a753639a8a4d937acf3e037)

commit_message:
api: Reject volume attach requests when an active bdm exists

When attaching volumes to instances Nova has previously relied on checks
carried out by c-api to ensure that a single non-multiattach volume is
not attached to multiple instances at once. While this works well in
most cases it does not handle PEBKAC issues when admins reset the state
of a volume to available, allowing users to request that Nova attach the
volume to another instance.

This change aims to address this by including a simple check in the
attach flow for non-multiattach volumes ensuring that there are no
existing active block device mapping records for the volume already
present within Nova.

Closes-Bug: #1908075
Change-Id: I2881d77d52bcbde9f3ac6a6ddfb4a22a9bd45c8a
(cherry picked from commit 1252588d4e48da1d3a753639a8a4d937acf3e037)
(cherry picked from commit 75cdbdd9c64353e8b73c36b184ea2140f0a4861d)

requesting charm should supply the 'system-role' key in the app
relation data bag to indicate whether the requested user should
be a system user. This charm creates the user if it does not exist

app relation data bag. The units radosgw url and daemon id
are also passed back this time using the unit relation data
bag.

commit_message:
Add radosgw-user relation

Add a radosgw-user relation to allow charms to request a user. The
requesting charm should supply the 'system-role' key in the app
relation data bag to indicate whether the requested user should
be a system user. This charm creates the user if it does not exist
or looks up the users credentials if it does. The username and
credentials are then passed back to the requestor via the
app relation data bag. The units radosgw url and daemon id
are also passed back this time using the unit relation data
bag.

Change-Id: Ieff1943b02f490559ccd245f60b744fb76a5d832

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-14 11:00:52.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Do not destroy volume secrets during _hard_reboot

Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a unfortunately missed that
resume_state_on_host_boot calls down into _hard_reboot always removing
volume secrets rendering that change useless.

This change seeks to address this by using the destroy_secrets kwarg
introduced by I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3 within the
_hard_reboot method of the libvirt driver to ensure secrets are not
removed during a hard reboot.

This resolves the original issue in bug #1905701 *and* allows admins to
hard reboot a users instance when that instance has encrypted volumes
attached with secrets stored in Barbican. This latter use case being
something we can easily test within tempest unlike the compute reboot in
bug #1905701.

This change is kept small as it should ideally be backported alongside
Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a to stable/queens. Follow up
changes on master will improve formatting, doc text and introduce
functional tests to further validate this new behaviour of hard reboot
within the libvirt driver.

Closes-Bug: #1905701
Change-Id: I3d1b21ba6eb3f5eb728693197c24b4b315eef821
(cherry picked from commit 26d65fc882e42b824409dff87ff026dee1debe20)
(cherry picked from commit 9cac2a8822ab81b7a0aa1f5b4472b306e4b68f93)

commit_message:
libvirt: Do not destroy volume secrets during _hard_reboot

Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a unfortunately missed that
resume_state_on_host_boot calls down into _hard_reboot always removing
volume secrets rendering that change useless.

This change seeks to address this by using the destroy_secrets kwarg
introduced by I856268b371f7ba712b02189db3c927cd762a4dc3 within the
_hard_reboot method of the libvirt driver to ensure secrets are not
removed during a hard reboot.

This resolves the original issue in bug #1905701 *and* allows admins to
hard reboot a users instance when that instance has encrypted volumes
attached with secrets stored in Barbican. This latter use case being
something we can easily test within tempest unlike the compute reboot in
bug #1905701.

This change is kept small as it should ideally be backported alongside
Ia2007bc63ef09931ea0197cef29d6a5614ed821a to stable/queens. Follow up
changes on master will improve formatting, doc text and introduce
functional tests to further validate this new behaviour of hard reboot
within the libvirt driver.

Closes-Bug: #1905701
Change-Id: I3d1b21ba6eb3f5eb728693197c24b4b315eef821
(cherry picked from commit 26d65fc882e42b824409dff87ff026dee1debe20)
(cherry picked from commit 9cac2a8822ab81b7a0aa1f5b4472b306e4b68f93)

commit_message:
Document adding files into TCIB build environment

Provide an example of installing a custom package from a file, while
building an extra layer of a container. This also illustrates how to
switch users while building new layer from a base container.

Closes-bug: #1942438

Change-Id: I479265278bd480352d7515a6af9b5a7115422e00
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Rename notify to publish in unit tests

After [1] patch merging all neutron code will be
switched to payload style callback[2].
Neutron-lib registry.notify can be depricated

1) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/806607
2)https://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=registry.notify&i=nope&literal=nope&files=&excludeFiles=&repos=

Change-Id: I5a549c4d09822659f7e4cdd08b085d856f3b65ed

commit_message:
neutron-lib: Skip functional tests for changes in unit tests code

... because any change in unit tests code does never affect
functionality.

Change-Id: I05a828044785982d6555a93a3827bf105922840b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:11:56.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py
      neutron/scheduler/base_resource_filter.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432
(cherry picked from commit 668b1cc652f076e555ef1fc1289684367159186a)
(cherry picked from commit 816aca60b90b89038863d6974b5a9e0ee8983424)
(cherry picked from commit 1eb6b8926a7a5ad442c5af6057c042999e2645f1)
(cherry picked from commit f315f85a7b0ead30877e19988db4e4f80fc960e9)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not fail if the agent load is not bumped

When a new network and its first subnet is created, the DHCP agent
bumps the "load" parameter to reflect the number of networks handled.
This "load" parameter is modified when:
- As commented, when the first subnet of a network is created. The
  "load" value is bumped.
- When periodically the DHCP agent sends the status, informing about
  the current number of networks handled.

If during the subnet creation this "load" value is not updated, it will
be in the next periodic update of the agent.

This "load" value is used by the scheduler to equally distribute the
objects to be managed by any agent type (DHCP agents manage networks).

The bug refers to DHCP but is valid for any other agent.

Conflicts:
      neutron/common/utils.py
      neutron/scheduler/base_resource_filter.py

Change-Id: Ief402048d99d40b64d81fcf58eb2e39b1ba7ebbb
Closes-Bug: #1939432
(cherry picked from commit 668b1cc652f076e555ef1fc1289684367159186a)
(cherry picked from commit 816aca60b90b89038863d6974b5a9e0ee8983424)
(cherry picked from commit 1eb6b8926a7a5ad442c5af6057c042999e2645f1)
(cherry picked from commit f315f85a7b0ead30877e19988db4e4f80fc960e9)

commit_message:
Ensure net dict has provider info on precommit delete

Commit 80eddc40390e63c9c1102b827997054708f2618b optimized
net delete by including net info into notification payload,
however ML2 plugin needs provider info as well.

Closes-Bug: #1942469
Change-Id: I9f753be0ce5ae7870afb9b3cb74f89be8482356e

commit_message:
Fix notify listener syntax for SEGMENT_HOST_MAPPING

Change auto_schedule_new_network_segments call to use old notification
listener syntax in old stable branches of Neutron that still use
notify instead of publish.
Fix only needed for stable/stein, stable/rocky, stable/queens

Closes-Bug: #1939125
Change-Id: I99a50725a514b324d3f886db9fd2d3dd37efd031
(cherry picked from commit 7f63139424adcbbc18cdbf1b0fa3efa3b0fd3f45)

commit_message:
Repro allocation show bug with empty allocation

This patch adds a functional test case to reproduce the bug when an
allocation show command on an empty (non existent) allocation causes
KeyError as the code expects project_id in the response but the
response is {"allocations":{}}. Also similarly for allocation unset
where microversion 1.38 fails on parsing out consumer_type from the
empty allocation too.

Related-Bug: #1942740

Change-Id: Iea27c9376480e3e94d12eec56b466331e5c6f171

commit_message:
Replace tempest_test_whitelist with tempest_allowed_group

This patch remove the tempest_test_whitelist from the fatureset, making
it easy to overwrite it in tempest playbook. It replace the
tempest_test_whitelist with tempest_allowed_group that is handled by
openstack-tempest-skiplist tool.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/802484

Change-Id: I8ce7530bcf14ed1b23e357c67e98ce9079b5df02

commit_message:
Remove tempest_test_whitelist from featureset052 jobs

This patch remove tempest_test_whitelist from featureset 052 based jobs.
This will enable the same to use the new openstack-tempest-skiplist
allowed role, that will from now on handle the list of tempest tests to
be executed.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/792909

Change-Id: I709519240ac4dc159f49c2534a876ba981540c5d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-08 11:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix - os-vif fails to get the correct UpLink Representor

Till kernel 5.7 PF and VF representors are exposed as virtual device.
They are not linked to its parent PCI device like how uplink
representor is linked.

Starting from kernel 5.8 due to new change [1] the PF and VF representors are
linked to their parent PCI device, and so "get_ifname_by_pci_address" fails
to get the correct UpLink Representor.

This patch modifys the behviour of "get_ifname_by_pci_address" to
check the physical port name of the netdev in
vf_pci_addr_path/physfn/net to match the formart for the uplink "p\d+".

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/netdev/net.git/commit/?id=123f0f53dd64b67e34142485fe866a8a581f12f1

Closes-Bug: #1892132
Change-Id: I49f6ae3f0e6bfbf555c8284bfd70371ce90da0c7
(cherry picked from commit b37de19c58c877f5174d76d0a4ba5ab519f464e8)

commit_message:
Fix - os-vif fails to get the correct UpLink Representor

Till kernel 5.7 PF and VF representors are exposed as virtual device.
They are not linked to its parent PCI device like how uplink
representor is linked.

Starting from kernel 5.8 due to new change [1] the PF and VF representors are
linked to their parent PCI device, and so "get_ifname_by_pci_address" fails
to get the correct UpLink Representor.

This patch modifys the behviour of "get_ifname_by_pci_address" to
check the physical port name of the netdev in
vf_pci_addr_path/physfn/net to match the formart for the uplink "p\d+".

[1] https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/netdev/net.git/commit/?id=123f0f53dd64b67e34142485fe866a8a581f12f1

Closes-Bug: #1892132
Change-Id: I49f6ae3f0e6bfbf555c8284bfd70371ce90da0c7
(cherry picked from commit a28aafa796378b8a36ccb51d2c0010a44f622d14)

commit_message:
Add support for the interface parameter in authtoken middleware

This patch adds support for [keystone_authtoken] interface parameter,
so that operators can define which endpoint should be used by authtoken
middleware.

Change-Id: I13166e0bc38cce220f3ccc735d85f7a00a4e163e
(cherry picked from commit c10b870dd28abe4c2843a475fcff2ade5f758674)

[{'created': '2020-12-03 23:10:57.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor code of linux_net to more cleaner and increase performace

The patch adds new functions '_get_phys_port_name' for reading physical
port name of the SR-IOV port and '_get_phys_switch_id' for reading
physical port switch ID of the SR-IOV port, in addition to refactoring
'get_representor_port' to use the new functions and decrease calls for
"_get_pf_func" and netdevs associated with the PF will now be processed
in the loop, however it will not be matching 'phys_port_name' which
ensures the correct behaviour.

In addition to updating the unit test for linux_net and remove not
needed mocks

commit_message:
Refactor code of linux_net to more cleaner and increase performace

The patch adds new functions '_get_phys_port_name' for reading physical
port name of the SR-IOV port and '_get_phys_switch_id' for reading
physical port switch ID of the SR-IOV port, in addition to refactoring
'get_representor_port' to use the new functions and decrease calls for
"_get_pf_func" and netdevs associated with the PF will now be processed
in the loop, however it will not be matching 'phys_port_name' which
ensures the correct behaviour.

In addition to updating the unit test for linux_net and remove not
needed mocks

Conflicts:
      vif_plug_ovs/linux_net.py
      vif_plug_ovs/tests/unit/test_linux_net.py

Related-Bug: #1892132
Change-Id: I3fdbea4f48cb79ebfd03a4da21e2232ccafb7a76
(cherry picked from commit 167bb030f1143f37ce189673d831bd572f64d4ad)

commit_message:
NovaLiveMigrationPermitAutoConverge should default to True

This is to match NovaLiveMigrationPermitPostCopy which is going to be
disabled if needed on RT hosts and in DPDK situations.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1920229
Change-Id: I7aeb00994daac23bab890bc70e6fbfc2e1ee9a66

commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertDictContainsSubset

The method is deprecated since Python 3.2[1] and shows the following
DeprecationWarning.

/usr/lib/python3.9/unittest/case.py:1134: DeprecationWarning:
assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated
  warnings.warn('assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated',

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.2.html#unittest

Closes-Bug: #1938103
Change-Id: I1d0ee6c77476707a7e4fe4fbf2b979bf34550d05

commit_message:
Release mistral for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to mistral since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 10.0.0..2a1736f0
2a1736f0 Add a migration that deletes redundant delayed calls
e049c501 Monkey patch original current_thread _active
0c09906c Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
940d777a Update .gitreview for stable/ussuri

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I26efb5bf0023b88ea0dbe980556420873ee10428

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-23 17:40:21.000000000', 'message': 'Release mistral-dashboard for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to mistral-dashboard since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

0fe6e0f Fix gate jobs
6565258 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
c811f07 Update .gitreview for stable/ussuri

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I47f77eb0f6273ea921941cb5b87dda7e14b2da2a
'}]
commit_message:
Release mistral-dashboard for stable/ussuri

This release picks up new commits to mistral-dashboard since
the last release from stable/ussuri.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 10.0.0..1260d3e
1260d3e Setting DEFAULT to False.
0fe6e0f Fix gate jobs
6565258 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
c811f07 Update .gitreview for stable/ussuri

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I47f77eb0f6273ea921941cb5b87dda7e14b2da2a

[{'created': '2021-09-03 18:31:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix some api-ref typos

There were some places in the API ref that it shows a 202 is
returned on Update, but we always return a 200 (HTTPOk).
Fixed a few other cases where Create (should be 201) and
Delete (should be 204) were wrong as well.

Change-Id: I4f6eb742f4420d0844e9c254ce989fc62973b0cf
Closes-bug: #1942448
'}]
commit_message:
Fix some api-ref typos

There were some places in the API ref that it shows a 202 is
returned on Update, but we always return a 200 (HTTPOk).
Fixed a few other cases where Create (should be 201) and
Delete (should be 204) were wrong as well.

Change-Id: I4f6eb742f4420d0844e9c254ce989fc62973b0cf
Closes-bug: #1942448

commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertDictContainsSubset

The method is deprecated since Python 3.2[1] and shows the following
DeprecationWarning.

/usr/lib/python3.9/unittest/case.py:1134: DeprecationWarning:
assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated
  warnings.warn('assertDictContainsSubset is deprecated',

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.2.html#unittest

Closes-Bug: #1938103
Change-Id: Iab60f52ffbfb3668e9509ce86e105917c616b8a9

commit_message:
[fuel] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Idd2855b09fe0f13c6cac92fe8c8e6302ff5abbdf

commit_message:
[Packaging-rpm] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I384d36bc4f3be5490f9eed192b3a3b8267c1f8b7

These are already replaced by overcloud-hardened-uefi-full jobs in
wallaby and master, and the overcloud-hardened-full images definitions
will be deleted from tripleo-common.

Change-Id: I7a27db14e25204c99111b7b3ea0a3038dac0c39b
Blueprint: whole-disk-default

commit_message:
[neutron] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Iec21a5bf9da4f8f516d027254cf4f1c2830ecdec

commit_message:
Skip DVR binding for ports with invalid OFPORT

Invalid OFPORT (-1) causes ofctl errors and timeouts if set
it as output in a flow rule.

Closes-Bug: #1938685
Change-Id: Ib8be66c3068309832e08066af4e0b75c30e8163a
(cherry picked from commit 63a2a65bbe9ab2ec054f47f581b505dfeb441307)

commit_message:
Enabling cover job in the zuul

Measuring coverage for each patch will help us pinpoint
where we lack test coverage and quickly determine if
the newly introduced code doesn't have negative impact on it.

Coverage measurement is not set as a dependcy for the more complex actions
in the check pipeline, so we are unlikely to see delays in patches passing.

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic37d30c8c1920f7d315dd7da12418d60509c42d4

commit_message:
version-check: Use independent release data as default

Rally is a project uploading point release tarballs but doing releases
independently - this change moves rally to proper section and enables
independent projects processing by default (previous default was False).

Change-Id: I940b1e20b2bf7f63fa3fdaf5c367ece12c574989

commit_message:
Replace the 'try except' block
The goal is to avoid the error
```
Attribute [] not found in [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7fc649c52520>]: ''.
```
in debug messages when the field `_alternate_id` is empty.
It uses a Walrus operator to affect variable `key` during the emptiness test

Change-Id: I7ded5a3fd6bb962b0d83ffae9ca5ceea5ef22b58

subject: Replace the 'try except' block
messages:
[{'account_id': 33945, 'date': '2021-09-03 14:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33945, 'date': '2021-09-03 14:28:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2021-09-03 21:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me! Thanks Thomas.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2021-09-04 07:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Great, but! You still have produced 3 changes instead of one. And those are chained, meaning we can not merge this one without merging previous 2. And we will never be able to merge those cause they are failing.
What you need to do now is rebase this change on top of HEAD and abandon 2 other changes.
For you next contributions please make really sure you amend the commit and not produce new stacked changes.'}, {'account_id': 33945, 'date': '2021-09-04 09:40:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

New commit is https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/807427 and it should be on branch feature/r1 and only 1 commit far from Head.
But I don't know how to cancel these three..."}, {'account_id': 33945, 'date': '2021-09-06 09:53:08.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Can't be merged because of the previous 2 commits (I forgot to use commit --amend)"}]

commit_message:
Replace the 'try except' block

The goal is to avoid the error
```
Attribute [] not found in [<openstack.resource._ComponentManager object at 0x7fc649c52520>]: ''.
```
in debug messages when the field `_alternate_id` is empty

Change-Id: Ic99b859c87c240379e2606a39a37918cd56433f6

commit_message:
Fix keystone authentication

Changes project_domain_id and user_domain_id to *_name in manila.conf

Add defensive mechanism to fallback to `_id` if `_name` is not set

Closes-Bug: #1911424
Change-Id: I6240b7b7e4590a21f034b9c70247e87ec18d867d

commit_message:
Add max_connect_errors configuration option.

This change adds the config option max_connect_errors for MySQL to this
charm and sets a default of 100.
Commit also includes the inclusion of this (default) config setting in the
unit tests.
Closes-Bug: #1776908

Change-Id: I33b9e29bd64ad8a1fec0edc3dfd657a87648b537

commit_message:
Add support for independent manila-dashboard configurations

This change introduces the new horizon::dashboards::manila class,
which allows users to manage the independent configuration file for
manila dashboard (_90_manila_shares.py).

Conflicts:
        manifests/params.pp

Backport note to Ussuri:
- The log_handlers option is not available in Ussuri so it is replaced
  by the old log_handler option.
- This change includes what was fixed by follow-up commit[1] in
  Victoria.
  [1] 23ebe3bf02f903abbba885f17dc56590fcf6a51e

Backport note to Train:
- Replaced relative names used to include classes because the old lint
  rules in train enforces usage of absolute names.

Change-Id: Ie1442d34b6837ced5f44018d038d4d716d568655
(cherry picked from commit a7d71fb37d7638d19f9ba22650a49c93b2be9142)

(cherry picked from commit c7fd4ad4bbcdc6c169716b25aeabde5d9659ac34)

[{'created': '2021-08-26 17:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for independent heat-dashboard configurations

Currently horizon supports per-dashboard configurations in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.d. Each dashboard plugin
provides a specific file to define its parameters, and any parameters
used in dashboard plugins have been removed from the base
local_settings(.py) in horizon repo.

To follow how each plugin is supposed to have its configurations
managed, this change introduces an independent file for heat-dashboard.
Support for the other dashboards like manila-ui, octavia-ui, and etc
will be added later.

Conflicts:
	manifests/init.pp
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb
	templates/local_settings.py.erb

Backport note:
To minimize effect of this backport, the following change was made.
- The enable_user_pass parameter is not deprecated by this patch.

- Users can set the enable_user_pass parameter to undef to remove
  OPENSTACK_HEAT_STACK from local_settings.

- heatclient logging setting is left in local_settings, because
  consistent configuration is added.

Backport note to Ussuri:
- The log_handlers option is not available in Ussuri so it is replaced
  by the old log_handler option.
- This change includes what was fixed by follow-up commit[1] in
  Victoria.
  [1] 23ebe3bf02f903abbba885f17dc56590fcf6a51e

(to stable/train)

commit_message:
Add support for independent heat-dashboard configurations

Currently horizon supports per-dashboard configurations in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.d. Each dashboard plugin
provides a specific file to define its parameters, and any parameters
used in dashboard plugins have been removed from the base
local_settings(.py) in horizon repo.

To follow how each plugin is supposed to have its configurations
managed, this change introduces an independent file for heat-dashboard.
Support for the other dashboards like manila-ui, octavia-ui, and etc
will be added later.

Conflicts:
	manifests/init.pp
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb
	templates/local_settings.py.erb

Backport note:
To minimize effect of this backport, the following change was made.
- The enable_user_pass parameter is not deprecated by this patch.

- Users can set the enable_user_pass parameter to undef to remove
  OPENSTACK_HEAT_STACK from local_settings.

- heatclient logging setting is left in local_settings, because
  consistent configuration is added.

Backport note to Ussuri:
- The log_handlers option is not available in Ussuri so it is replaced
  by the old log_handler option.
- This change includes what was fixed by follow-up commit[1] in
  Victoria.
  [1] 23ebe3bf02f903abbba885f17dc56590fcf6a51e

Backport note to Train:
- Replaced relative names used to include classes because the old lint
  rules in train enforces usage of absolute names.

Change-Id: I5999c2eaf8d7788d3c0d76e69a56a0b10058dfe9
(cherry picked from commit 382877dd4c8ee321eff1846c7c7afe4104dbd58f)
(cherry picked from commit 655e0df25e40b401d2daa5d673a416215ccd17b7)
(cherry picked from commit 80acdcca4dcbd058d72b5099054cc6b1b8b798b1)
(cherry picked from commit bf021098cc262097fd7945f284d04b46c69a2b66)

commit_message:
Add support for independent octavia-dashboard configurations

This change introduces the new horizon::dashboards::octavia class,
which allows users to manage the independent configuration file for
octavia dashboard (_1499_load_balancer_settings.py).

Conflicts:
	manifests/params.pp

Backport note to Ussuri:
- The log_handlers option is not available in Ussuri so it is replaced
  by the old log_handler option.
- This change includes what was fixed by follow-up commit[1] in
  Victoria.
  [1] 23ebe3bf02f903abbba885f17dc56590fcf6a51e

Backport note to Train:
- Replaced relative names used to include classes because the old lint
  rules in train enforces usage of absolute names.

Change-Id: I54f7fb778bc2487bf977e23e193773d627d91dd9
(cherry picked from commit c29622ee456494e6a34f62ded5747585a7ec5e62)
(cherry picked from commit d61cf671ee738ecaece14eaa3377c38274b366c7)

(cherry picked from commit 7f3cf8d500a3ae7d65f0fbbb7856744bc1712871)

commit_message:
Change default volume API to v3

Volumes v2 API was deprecated in pike and v3(.0)
 is identical to v2 API.
v3 was introduced in Mitaka

Change-Id: I38613145ae4234956f36184eb62feb8e95647113

commit_message:
Re-enable multinode gating jobs

Now that the kubeadm-aio is fixed, we can re-enable the
multinode jobs for gating against openstack-helm.

Change-Id: Ib1f1bca5f370e0326ea0211dfcfba9544bd458b2

commit_message:
Cleanup unused jobs

This change removes a bunch of old and duplicated jobs,
duplicate netpol and the old armada jobs that have not
been maintained. Also removed the tls job from
experimental since we run it now in gating.

Change-Id: Ic19520d8790c52d66d62b20a23658c57d954697e

[{'created': '2021-08-30 21:17:58.000000000', 'message': 'Only consider mounted OSD directories

When gathering the list of local OSD ids, the charm would consider
the entries under '/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-XXX' where 'XXX" was the
OSD id. However, if an entry under that directory isn't mounted,
then the OSD that would represent that entry should be discarded,
as it's no longer active. This patchset thus filters those entries
by looking for them in the mount points.

commit_message:
Only consider mounted OSD directories

When gathering the list of local OSD ids, the charm would consider
the entries under '/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-XXX' where 'XXX" was the
OSD id. However, if an entry under that directory isn't mounted,
then the OSD that would represent that entry should be discarded,
as it's no longer active. This patchset thus filters those entries
by looking for them in the mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1934938
Change-Id: I69c6356e450cc0c96de4afe571b438d4a2ea5177

commit_message:
fix: Fix cannot create network with ipv6 and other issues

1. Fix the gateway_ip form item to prevent wrong verification
2. Fix checkCidr function to make sure correct verification of empty values
3. Fix rule message to match form label with empty value
4. Add `maskClosable = false` to prevent closing the modal by mistake when filling in the form, causing all inputs to be cleared

Change-Id: I55f504b6a457de7ff0dd1017453a1cd800f4610a

commit_message:
Add base helm3 job

This change adds a new script and job to deploy minikube with
helm3. This job will be improved upon in later changes as
part of the movement to helm3.

Change-Id: Ia7ef30a4e2af77508ad95191e5241d2c1b83a7c4

commit_message:
Skip some FTs failed due to heat bug

Due to a bug in heat project, the some FTs don't pass.
This patch temporarily skip fail tests that until the bug is resolved.

* Due to heat bug reported in [1].
  functional.legacy.vnfm.test_vnf_placement_policy.VnfTestCreate
  - test_create_delete_vnf_with_placement_policy_affinity()
  - test_create_delete_vnf_with_placement_policy_anti_affinity()
  - test_vnf_with_policy_anti_affinity_insufficient_comp_nodes()

Skip should be removed as soon as the bug is resolved.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2009164

Change-Id: I8784603c875a93790014930004b90c39155c9e71

commit_message:
Expect python3 package in CentOS8 and Fedora

In CentOS 8.x and Fedora, we expect to have python3 package, while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Change-Id: I298706690ee73db76678653841514de120c61e27
(cherry picked from commit faaaa4a7736423c9f5f6be239aef48ee7dc8ed9b)

'}]
commit_message:
Add cloud-provider flag to openstack cloud control manager

Recent OpenStack Cloud Control Manager (occm) fails without
cloud-provider flag, starting v1.21.0 onwards --cloud-provider cannot be
empty Error: --cloud-provider cannot be empty

Additionally, add create role for serviceaccounts/token resource [1].

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes/cloud-provider-openstack/blob/7d844dac9d4bbfd5eee919ce84e1534b5476ee73/manifests/controller-manager/cloud-controller-manager-roles.yaml#L52-L57

Story: 2009023
Task: 42745
Change-Id: I55042665c25704cd65eb4e4883f8a796bdcdaa7f
(cherry picked from commit 12766eaff883b6d7f11cd71d36f69727dc9f8ede)

  so there is no need to expose those parameters again.

commit_message:
Database: add slave_connection support

Cinder is able to talk to a read-only database for some tables so it
improves the scalability of MySQL server and reduce the access to the
server in charge of writes. More documentation:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Slave_usage

commit_message:
Database: add slave_connection support

Neutron is able to talk to a read-only database for some tables so it
improves the scalability of MySQL server and reduce the access to the
server in charge of writes. More documentation:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Slave_usage

Change-Id: Iaf42735b76da9c7f1713585731814e4dc711a327

commit_message:
Database: add slave_connection support

Glance is able to talk to a read-only database for some tables so it
improves the scalability of MySQL server and reduce the access to the
server in charge of writes. More documentation:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Slave_usage

Change-Id: I1b0147020b963d0227639d489e22c621d2f9ea78

commit_message:
Database: add slave_connection support

Mistral is able to talk to a read-only database for some tables so it
improves the scalability of MySQL server and reduce the access to the
server in charge of writes. More documentation:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Slave_usage

Change-Id: I8d6e0b83d67746b8770508174afa5cdffa375042

Kicking this out of the gate because we just realized these tests aren't setting enforce_new_defaults, which means they're not actually testing the changes to the policy."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-02 21:27:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-02 22:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 43: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-09-02 22:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 41: Code-Review-1 -Workflow
> 
> Kicking this out of the gate because we just realized these tests aren't setting enforce_new_defaults, which means they're not actually testing the changes to the policy.

Sorry, that was me being stupid and responding to Lance's realization that we don't fail if we break the policy. I forgot about the rbac job and was going based on the fact that these espouse to be "test_role_base.*" and thinking we weren't ever running them with new defaults.

So, I rebased the whole set, fixed Lance's noted missing cases. I will re-+W these assuming I didn't break anything.'}]

commit_message:
Implement project personas for metadef namespaces

This commit updates the policies for metadef namespaces
to use default roles available from keystone.

Co-Authored-By: Abhishek Kekane <akekane@redhat.com>
Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

Change-Id: I7bc678b1f61b204574f3a59b6c686fd771af5f54

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-03 14:49:16.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix tox jobs timing out

Tox jobs are timing out in CI due to pip dependency resolution
backtracking taking too long. When run locally, pip fails to resolve
dependencies due to upper-constraints now allowing pluggy 1.0.0 [1],
while molecule still depends on pluggy >= 0.7.1, < 1.0. See similar
tripleo bug for more details [1].

Split molecule dependencies in a separate requirements file and disable
its CI job for now. This allows other tox jobs to complete. As a bonus,
it should speed up execution of the jobs.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/806680
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942508

Change-Id: I4cad83c92c32d1db2a5d3c03a78a1c533a8b9633
'}, {'created': '2021-09-03 15:02:49.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Fix tox jobs timing out

backtracking taking too long. When run locally, pip fails to resolve
dependencies due to upper-constraints now allowing pluggy 1.0.0 [1],

tripleo bug for more details [1].

Split molecule dependencies in a separate requirements file and remove
upper constraints from its tox environment for now. This allows other
tox jobs to complete. As a bonus, it should speed up execution of the
jobs due to installing fewer dependencies.

This also fixes the other CI issue caused by docker 5.0.1 [3].

[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/807128

commit_message:
CI: Fix multiple failures

Tox jobs are timing out in CI due to pip dependency resolution
backtracking taking too long. When run locally, pip fails to resolve
dependencies due to upper-constraints now allowing pluggy 1.0.0 [1],
while molecule still depends on pluggy >= 0.7.1, < 1.0. See similar
tripleo bug for more details [2].

Split molecule dependencies in a separate requirements file and remove
upper constraints from its tox environment for now. As a bonus, it
should speed up execution of the jobs due to installing fewer
dependencies.

Stop using upper-constraints when installing docker python library [3].
This part of the commit can be reverted when docker 5.0.2 is in upper
constraints.

Update Kolla inventory template following renaming of haproxy role to
loadbalancer [4]. With the existing template, haproxy/keepalived
containers are not created and service deployment fails while trying to
connect to MySQL using the VIP.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/806680
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1942508
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/807128
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/770618

Change-Id: I4cad83c92c32d1db2a5d3c03a78a1c533a8b9633
Co-Authored-By: Mark Goddard <mark@stackhpc.com>

commit_message:
Victoria and before: Build containers only once in TripleO jobs

Currently container images are built in two TripleO jobs, (standalone
and undercloud) but this is redundant and inefficient. This change
makes container images built by the base content provide job used for
these two jobs.
Because undercloud job was removed in stable/wallaby this change is
submitted to stable/victoria and older branches.

Change-Id: Iebedb2b7bb702c82946b9436f98c1ae08d4b6b35
