commit_message:
Revert "Add content provider jobs for tripleo based jobs"

This reverts commit 2a0f3db4be7412b3cdf22e63a44088b2367fd819.

Reason for Revert:
The change imports the job directly from TripleO repos but we should
use the one overridden for Puppet OpenStack repos.

Note for Revert:
This issue was fixed during the wallaby cucle when removing Undercloud
job so is submitted to stable/victoria directly.

Change-Id: I9ef8fd94fbbbb909c992cf3b16cd1b5670b10845

commit_message:
'community' images need to be treated as public

Even though 'community' images are not listed by default their
behaviour is like public images otherwise. This means that
the image data needs to be available for everyone and thus
the acls for the file/object should be like public too.

Change-Id: I79683c81233b35f2399119128a63d33d69c50eeb
Closes-bug: #1885928

commit_message:
Snapshot in-use volumes without force flag

Introduces API microversion 3.66, which allows
snapshot creation on in-use volumes without the
force flag being passed.

Co-authored-by: Eric Harney <eharney@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Implements: blueprint fix-snapshot-create-force
Change-Id: I6d45aeab065197a85ce62740fc95306bce9dfc45

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-04 12:41:56.000000000', 'message': 'Allow 'bochs' as a display device option

The 'bochs' display device is a recommended[1] safe option for UEFI
guests.  This is supported in libvirt from version 5.6.0; Nova's current
MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION (6.0.0) satisfies this requirement.

Partially quoting the "bochs display device" section a post written by a
QEMU graphics maintainer[1]:

[quote]
    [...] Main advantage over standard VGA is that this device is alot
    simpler.  The code size and complexity needed to emulate this device
    is an order of magnitude smaller, resulting in a reduced attack
    surface. Another nice feature is that you can place this device in a
    PCI Express slot.

    For UEFI guests it is safe to use the bochs display device instead
    of the standard VGA device. The firmware will setup a linear
    framebuffer as GOP anyway and never use any legacy VGA features.

    For BIOS guests this device might be useable as well, depending on
    whenever they depend on direct VGA hardware access or not. There is
    a vgabios which supports text rendering on a linear framebuffer, so
    software which uses the vgabios services for text output will
    continue to work. Linux bootloaders typically fall into this
    category. The linux text mode console (vgacon) uses direct hardware
    access and does not work. The framebuffer console (fbcon running on
    vesafb or bochs-drm) works.
[/quote]

[1] https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2019/09/display-devices-in-qemu/

Change-Id: Id194028f5d2cbaac1c5e699b71fd9751f87f5da5
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-06-07 15:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'Allow 'bochs' as a display device option

commit_message:
Allow 'bochs' as a display device option

The 'bochs' display device is a recommended[1] safe option for UEFI
guests.  This is supported in libvirt from version 5.6.0; Nova's current
MIN_LIBVIRT_VERSION (6.0.0) satisfies this requirement.

Partially quoting the "bochs display device" section from a post written
by a QEMU graphics maintainer[1]:

    [...] Main advantage over standard VGA is that this device is alot
    simpler.  The code size and complexity needed to emulate this device
    is an order of magnitude smaller, resulting in a reduced attack
    surface. Another nice feature is that you can place this device in a
    PCI Express slot.

    For UEFI guests it is safe to use the bochs display device instead
    of the standard VGA device. The firmware will setup a linear
    framebuffer as GOP anyway and never use any legacy VGA features.

    For BIOS guests this device might be useable as well, depending on
    whenever they depend on direct VGA hardware access or not. There is
    a vgabios which supports text rendering on a linear framebuffer, so
    software which uses the vgabios services for text output will
    continue to work. Linux bootloaders typically fall into this
    category. The linux text mode console (vgacon) uses direct hardware
    access and does not work. The framebuffer console (fbcon running on
    vesafb or bochs-drm) works.

[1] https://www.kraxel.org/blog/2019/09/display-devices-in-qemu/

Implements: blueprint add-bochs-display-device

Change-Id: Id194028f5d2cbaac1c5e699b71fd9751f87f5da5
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for victoria.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

commit_message:
Remove branch handling for deleted branches

We still had conditional logic for branches that have since
been removed. This cleans up these old branches so they don't
need to be evaluated every time.

Change-Id: I55a34fd5c8ec2346353aaf9cf021493a54e86ba8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add optional healthcheck middleware

This change introduces a new option, [healthcheck] enabled, which
enables the healthcheck middleware in mistral-api pipeline.

This middleware allows status check at /healthcheck path, which is
useful for load balancers or any monitoring services to validate health
of its backend services.

This change is created based on the same change proposed to ironic[1].

[1] 6f439414bdcef9fc02f844f475ec798d48d42558

Co-Authored-By: Jim Rollenhagen <jim@jimrollenhagen.com>
Change-Id: I9bf3de8a5ae6a8c9346285147732b773a3667f7e

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-29 08:49:37.000000000', 'message': "Allow deletion of compute service with no compute nodes

Consider the following situation:

- Using the Ironic virt driver
- Replacing (so removing and re-adding) all baremetal nodes
  associated with a single nova-compute service

The update resources periodic will have destroyed the compute node
records because they're no longer being reported by the virt driver.
If we then attempt to manually delete the compute service record, the
datbase layer will raise an exception, as there are no longer any
compute node records for the host. Previously, this exception would
get bubbled up as an error 500 in the API. This patch catches it and
allows service deletion to complete succefully.

Closes bug: 1860312
Change-Id: I2f9ad3df25306e070c8c3538bfed1212d6d8682f
(cherry picked from commit 880611df0b6b967adabd3f08886e385d0a100c5c)
(cherry picked from commit df5158bf3f80fd4362725dc280de67b88ece9952)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow deletion of compute service with no compute nodes

Consider the following situation:

- Using the Ironic virt driver
- Replacing (so removing and re-adding) all baremetal nodes
  associated with a single nova-compute service

The update resources periodic will have destroyed the compute node
records because they're no longer being reported by the virt driver.
If we then attempt to manually delete the compute service record, the
datbase layer will raise an exception, as there are no longer any
compute node records for the host. Previously, this exception would
get bubbled up as an error 500 in the API. This patch catches it and
allows service deletion to complete succefully.

Closes bug: 1860312
Change-Id: I2f9ad3df25306e070c8c3538bfed1212d6d8682f
(cherry picked from commit 880611df0b6b967adabd3f08886e385d0a100c5c)
(cherry picked from commit df5158bf3f80fd4362725dc280de67b88ece9952)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 09:05:42.000000000', 'message': "Ignore exit when ovn_rundir exists

Command will be failure when the target exists if we use
command 'ln -s'.
So before command, we set 'set +e' to ignore none-zero exit.
And after command, we re-set 'set -e' to catch non-zero exit.

Closes-bug: #1932534
Change-Id: I9e7d6ab0b2b52e6b38b218c17bc28fe295a0bb80
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore exit when ovn_rundir exists

Command will be failure when the target exists if we use
command 'ln -s'.
So before command, we set 'set +e' to ignore none-zero exit.
And after command, we re-set 'set -e' to catch non-zero exit.

Closes-bug: #1932534
Change-Id: I9e7d6ab0b2b52e6b38b218c17bc28fe295a0bb80

commit_message:
Remove glare depenendencies

The Glare project was removed from governance and has not had any
activity for three years. This removes python-glareclient from our
global requirements so we don't test compatibility with it any more.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iea0d6e0389a488d6a8a83a6810e06e8f22664e01

The glare project is no longer active, and it appears it is no longer

commit_message:
Remove python-glareclient dependency

The glare project is no longer active, and it appears it is no longer
being used in mistral-extra, but the dependency was never removed from
requirements.txt. This cleans that up.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ic09a6cf7d648607275c03bc180807efb0d93075d

commit_message:
Added post-install and post-upgrade for jobs in heat

Chart upgrading was failing due to some immutable fields are needed to upgrade before the jobs can be upgraded. For solving this issue, we have added the helm.sh/hook annotations with post-install and post-upgrade values. As for hook-weight annotations, we have added these to control the flow of the jobs with hook creation as the jobs are dependent. Like, db-init jobs need to run before db-sync and so on. Also values helm3_hook is introduced in values.yaml from which hooks can be disabled if needed.

Change-Id: Ibc99cb20482864f55daa12321e8d81414c1ef9f8

By default, we don't currently allow the Nova microversion
header for CORS requests.  It should be something that is
included out of the box because it's part of the core API.

Deployers can workaround this by overriding allow_headers,
but we should provide a better experience out of the box.

commit_message:
Allow X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version header in CORS

By default, we don't currently allow the Nova microversion
header for CORS requests.  It should be something that is
included out of the box because it's part of the core API.

Deployers can workaround this by overriding allow_headers,
but we should provide a better experience out of the box.

Closes-Bug: #1931908
Change-Id: Idf4650f36952331f02d7512580c21451f3ee3b63
(cherry picked from commit b02a95a18b5da37db6d4f30a5dea07e2a4187245)

commit_message:
Allow initial versions to not be created yet

The database schema upgrade check had support for an
explicit list of known versions to handle the upgrade.

who knew!

Anyhow, we haven't used it in three years since the addition,
and it seems to make more sense to just be able to indicate
"we know initial field versions may not be able to be retrieved
and act accordingly". As such, when no table is found, the
pre-upgrade version check execution will continue onward fearlessly!

Call it a spiritual successor to Ibcf0728bc5d1b0cbdd78796526f9c93fc99e8c08

Change-Id: Icae5162c2501b0d1217ad0e6ee34ebef40e95204

[{'created': '2021-01-21 04:26:41.000000000', 'message': "Add --sleep option for archive_deleted_rows --until-complete

Currently, when 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' is run with
the --until-complete option, the process will archive rows in batches
in a tight loop, which can cause problems in busy environments where
the aggressive archiving interferes with other requests trying to write
to the database.

This adds an option for users to specify an amount of time in seconds
to sleep between batches of rows while archiving with --until-complete,
allowing the process to be throttled.

Closes-Bug: #1912579

Change-Id: I638b2fa78b81919373e607458e6f68a7983a79aa

commit_message:
Add --sleep option for archive_deleted_rows --until-complete

Currently, when 'nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows' is run with
the --until-complete option, the process will archive rows in batches
in a tight loop, which can cause problems in busy environments where
the aggressive archiving interferes with other requests trying to write
to the database.

This adds an option for users to specify an amount of time in seconds
to sleep between batches of rows while archiving with --until-complete,
allowing the process to be throttled.

Closes-Bug: #1912579

Change-Id: I638b2fa78b81919373e607458e6f68a7983a79aa

messages:
[{'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-07-26 09:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-07-26 10:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is not specific to nova and should be implemented in openstacklib, IMO.

A reasonable option here would be to implement the purge_config option in openstacklib::policy::base and use that option because purging policy file results in problems with some components like Octavia which relies on policies relying on the default policy.yaml.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-07-26 11:44:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> This is not specific to nova and should be implemented in openstacklib, IMO.
> 
> A reasonable option here would be to implement the purge_config option in openstacklib::policy::base and use that option because purging policy file results in problems with some components like Octavia which relies on policies relying on the default policy.yaml.

I have looked into adding this to openstacklib but since the resource gets created e.g. here in nova I thought it might be best to do the check in the component which creates it. Let me look into adding a purge parameter like suggested.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-26 13:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Delete policy file if policies hash is empty

If all policies get deleted, previously created policy files won't
get removed and the api policy file is still used. Let's make
sure the policy file gets purged if the policies hash is empty.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/802305
Change-Id: Ic9b5ccd8fc23f6cebc06f62d972b64efd2400396

commit_message:
Use lookup() instead of iterating over table

The lookup method uses locks to avoid race conditions with other
ovsdbapp threads.

Change-Id: I27ea7ece3a7b81ec8eb3002773a7b71217da3991

[{'created': '2021-08-05 02:21:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix request path to query a resource provider by uuid

To query a resource provider by uuid, request path should look like
 /resource_providers?uuid=<uuid>
istead of
 /resource_providers&uuid=<uuid>

This change fixes the wrong path so that "nova-manage placement audit"
command can look up the target resource provider properly.

Closes-Bug: #1936278
Change-Id: I2ae7e9782316e3662e4e51e3f5ba0ef597bf281b
(cherry picked from commit 1d3373dcf0a05d4a2c5b51fc1b74d41ec1bb1175)

istead of

Closes-Bug: #1936278

(cherry picked from commit 1d3373dcf0a05d4a2c5b51fc1b74d41ec1bb1175)
(cherry picked from commit 62a3fa4fff70a1d03998626406a71b7dc09da733)

commit_message:
Fix request path to query a resource provider by uuid

To query a resource provider by uuid, request path should look like
 /resource_providers?uuid=<uuid>
istead of
 /resource_providers&uuid=<uuid>

This change fixes the wrong path so that "nova-manage placement audit"
command can look up the target resource provider properly.

Closes-Bug: #1936278
Change-Id: I2ae7e9782316e3662e4e51e3f5ba0ef597bf281b
(cherry picked from commit 1d3373dcf0a05d4a2c5b51fc1b74d41ec1bb1175)
(cherry picked from commit 62a3fa4fff70a1d03998626406a71b7dc09da733)

subject: Avoid excessive sleep in vmware unit test
messages:
[{'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-01 16:38:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2021-09-01 19:04:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/806956/1/iscsi : FAILURE in 2h 22m 24s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-01 21:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-09-03 20:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-09-04 05:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

I guess Lee meant +A instead of +RP :)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 16:38:51.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid excessive sleep in vmware unit test

The patch Id6e2be2b407eb08e269c35e0f89d235c67a1ab99 added a retry
decorator on create_vm in vmware driver. Such decorator makes the
negative unit test do excessive sleeps and retries. The test eventually
stopped by the test executor with a Timeout exception but the test was
modified to assert that as a success. This makes the test pass after
160 seconds.

This patch mocks the sleep behind the retry decorator to make the test
fast and reverts the assert in the test.

Change-Id: I7c7e698bf559b69a2f09402c265e6e387c3b077a
Related-Bug: #1908408
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid excessive sleep in vmware unit test

The patch Id6e2be2b407eb08e269c35e0f89d235c67a1ab99 added a retry
decorator on create_vm in vmware driver. Such decorator makes the
negative unit test do excessive sleeps and retries. The test eventually
stopped by the test executor with a Timeout exception but the test was
modified to assert that as a success. This makes the test pass after
160 seconds.

This patch mocks the sleep behind the retry decorator to make the test
fast and reverts the assert in the test.

Change-Id: I7c7e698bf559b69a2f09402c265e6e387c3b077a
Related-Bug: #1908408

commit_message:
Victoria and before: Build containers only once in TripleO jobs

Currently container images are built in two TripleO jobs, (standalone
and undercloud) but this is redundant and inefficient. This change
makes container images built by the base content provide job used for
these two jobs.
Because undercloud job was removed in stable/wallaby this change is
submitted to stable/victoria and older branches.

Change-Id: I13b798d18b7eed873c1c222e8bdf8e73110adb11

commit_message:
Add notice regarding Xenial gate

Add a deprecation notice indicating the removal of regular gate
testing for the Xenial series in the Yoga timeline. When a migration
to charmhub occurs, a separate series of tracks can be created for the
Xenial related OpenStack releases with specific gates for those.

The notice also indicates that the nature of maintenance will be limited
to critical and high security fixes only.

Change-Id: I395b01b1d321b198aa551f2e01fb0ff02da2bdd2

commit_message:
Add base Neutron service plugins to BGPVPN

Neutron API service will raise an error at init if some base service
plugins are not enabled. Add them to BGPVPN, similarly to other existing
Neutron THT environments.

Change-Id: I75e2950c4e52c5c78431ccfe66f128eb62e8a6d6
(cherry picked from commit da7bcec27ab3ccf6e9fea0dd8b925c8e8967bf00)

commit_message:
Stop rotating rabbitmq crash.log files via erlang's lager

The log file `/var/log/containers/rabbitmq/log/crash.log` is currently
being rotated by both the lager logging framework and the
logrotate_crond container.
This will give us logs like:
$ ll /var/log/containers/rabbitmq/log/
total 4
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 26 00:00 crash.log
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 25 00:00 crash.log.0
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 24 00:01 crash.log.1
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 23 00:01 crash.log.2
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 20 Aug 25 00:00 crash.log-20200825.gz
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 26 00:00 crash.log-20200826
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 22 00:00 crash.log.3
-rw-r-----. 1 42439 42439 0 Aug 21 00:01 crash.log.4

We need to disable the lager rotation and let logrotate do its job.

Tested by applying the patch and confirming, after some days,
that there is no double-rotation taking place.

NB: Patch context conflicts

Closes-Bug: #1941698

Change-Id: Ibfef67aac7730accbffbb3973b9087dfd15dcef4
(cherry picked from commit 236f14fe89b1699fab4f3b8dd1e222a0a670d3da)
(cherry picked from commit 9ae8a06837c5459dae768ee0eafc66135b266ad1)

commit_message:
Allow Set managed_resource_email on designate config.

With this patch managed_resource_email can be set via charm
with juju config managed-resource-email = email@domain.com
functional for auto generated SOA records. that came from
Floating IP.

Closes-Bug: #1940864
Change-Id: I9f55564316fdb559481909dd7b196ef8fd9fe612

I think I need more details as to why we need to update a lib on a stable branch before we can do so.

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#upper-constraints'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-06 15:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I think I need more details as to why we need to update a lib on a stable branch before we can do so.
> 
> https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#upper-constraints

The backport of patch in python-tripleoclient[0] depends on code in 1.2.0 release of validations libs.
But because of the upper constraints the tox-* jobs would consistently fail, as the 1.1.0 doesn't include the relevant patches for the validations-libs CLI.

Now the patch itself isn't substantial, but without it the newly exposed validations-log-path arg won't behave properly. The original bug that led to this patch, was found in 16.2 and the primary fixes were targeting it, 

If we decide there is no need for this functionality[2] in Wallaby, or earlier, there will be no need to change the constraints. But as it stands now, I don't have a firm guidance on that from the rest of our team. 

So I guess until then this will have to wait. For the better probably, wouldn't want to break things. 

[0]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/794577
[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/795093
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/789770/23"}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-09 13:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-11 09:39:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> I think I need more details as to why we need to update a lib on a stable branch before we can do so.
> 
> https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#upper-constraints

It appears that the functionality is targeting wallaby after all, so we will need to updated the constraints accordingly. 
Furthermore, there other items, included in the validations-libs>=1.2.0 like the metadata expansion[3], that are intended for the 17, so we need this for them as well.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-08-16 09:00:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
bumping validations-libs version

Validations libs recently underwent several important changes
that are now included in the 1.2.0 release.

The upper constraints have to be updated to ensure that proper
version of the package is pulled for tests and other purposes.

The backport of patch in python-tripleoclient[0] depends
on the code in the 1.2.0 release of validations libs.

But because of the upper constraints the tox-* jobs would consistently fail,
as the 1.1.0 doesn't include the relevant patches for the validations-libs CLI.
The original bug that led to this patch, was found in 16.2
and the primary fixes were targeting it.[2]

Furthermore,some featueres, planned for wallaby,
are only in the validations-libs>=1.2.0, like the metadata expansion.

[0]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/794577
[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/795093
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/789770

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3f0be9c39e030c2600f0723467d244699fbf173

commit_message:
Fix 1vcpu error with multiqueue and vif_type=tap

Fix for bug #1893263 introduced a regression where
1 vcpu instances would fail to build when paired with
multiqueue-enabled images, in the scenario vif_type=tap.

Solution is to not pass multiqueue parameter when
instances.get_flavor().vcpus = 1.

Closes-bug: #1939604
Change-Id: Iaccf2eeeb6e8bb80c658f51ce9ab4e8eb4093a55
(cherry picked from commit 7fc6fe6fae891eae42b36ccb9d69cd0f6d6db21d)
(cherry picked from commit aa5b8d12bcacc01e5f9be45cc1eef24ac9efd2fc)
(cherry picked from commit aaa56240b0311ad47ccccc3b7850ddc5b0a21702)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-05 00:15:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix upgrade logic to allow for bundled changes

The upgrade path logic was built to force a developer pattern to break
things such as new tables and features across multiple patches, and
the status check *can* explicitly fail if we don't explicitly go
hint to it that we've added table. Yes, we have a hard coded list...

Anyway, a better pattern is allow the db sync process to do the
appropriate needful. Run the status check, if it fails, fallback
and update the schema.

Also handles the explicit failure error and tries to return a human
friendly error message for when the table is not present.

In the end this allows us to merge schema changes such as additional
tables with their underlying objects and properly handle things as
long as the schema update works as expected. This allows us to
leverage an operational model of performing upgrades.

Change-Id: Id5f2a8068bc064e1ed1e376524850e4739f79ef2

commit_message:
Fix upgrade logic to allow for bundled changes

The upgrade path logic was built to force a developer pattern to break
things such as new tables and features across multiple patches, and
the status check *can* explicitly fail if we don't explicitly go
hint to it that we've added table. Yes, we have a hard coded list...

Anyway, a better pattern is allow the db sync process to do the
appropriate needful. Run the status check, if it fails, fallback
and update the schema.

Also handles the explicit failure error and tries to return a human
friendly error message for when the table is not present.

In the end this allows us to merge schema changes such as additional
tables with their underlying objects and properly handle things as
long as the schema update works as expected. This allows us to
leverage an operational model of performing upgrades.

Change-Id: Id5f2a8068bc064e1ed1e376524850e4739f79ef2

commit_message:
Get kubeadm working again

This change fixes several issues with kubeadm, notably
the tiller image url/version, as well as fixing the
docker python library missing.

Change-Id: I35528bd45c08ac8580d9875dc54b300a2137fe73

Neutorn uses oslo.cache library for caching. This change ensures that
options of the library are included in neutron.conf generated by

commit_message:
Include oslo.cache options in neutron.conf

Neutorn uses oslo.cache library for caching. This change ensures that
options of the library are included in neutron.conf generated by
oslo-config-generator.
This change also removes cache_utils module from neutron.opts because
the module is not used in that file.

Closes-Bug: #1940790
Change-Id: I9ccd145d5ea1a1e0033eb43b609cc6428ea95f23

commit_message:
API v2.46, added 'is_default' field to share types

Added 'is_default' field to share types and share group
types list. 'is_default' field will show Yes if the share type
or share group type is default.

Partial-Bug: #1823078

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-19 09:52:40.000000000', 'message': 'doc: allow_resize_to_same_host needs nova-api restarted

[DEFAULT]allow_resize_to_same host is a bit weird. It controls
scheduling, is set in the [DEFAULT] section, but needs nova-api to be
restarted for changes to take effect (the API layer calls
compute_api.resize(), and the allow_resize_to_same_host check is
performed there, and not in the scheduler). This patch adds a small
blurn to the config help text to explain this.

Change-Id: I5393dfaeaf123d28bb1889635792ee1ece2c5295
'}]
commit_message:
doc: allow_resize_to_same_host needs nova-api restarted

[DEFAULT]allow_resize_to_same host is a bit weird. It controls
scheduling, is set in the [DEFAULT] section, but needs nova-api to be
restarted for changes to take effect (the API layer calls
compute_api.resize(), and the allow_resize_to_same_host check is
performed there, and not in the scheduler). This patch adds a small
blurn to the config help text to explain this.

Change-Id: I5393dfaeaf123d28bb1889635792ee1ece2c5295

commit_message:
Do not zap a disk if it is used by lvm2

If the disk being zapped is used by lvm (if it contains the
lvm label and hasn't been pvremove'd) it's safer to simply
bail out of zapping it than attempt teardown through a force
pvremove, because the disk being zapped might be in fact in
use by some LV.

Closes-Bug: 1858519
Change-Id: I111475c5a4584a3e367c604ab51ce2ef3789ff7f

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-01 08:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Consider all router ports in is_lsp_router_port()

The function considered only device owners known to OVN. On migrated
environments the device owner could be different. The codebase contains
a constant tuple containing all router port device owners. This patch
uses the constant instead.

Change-Id: I026ac8ea9c35a425470a2eaede35b3bfeba259c3
Closes-bug: #1941902
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903e66e8e73600fcc251fb5e8ad85d88171bf95b)

commit_message:
tripleo-podman: Enable podman.socket

Instead of relying on nsenter in the various wrappers, we should use
podman --remote. To do this, we need to enable podman.socket.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800847
Related-Bug: #1936005
Change-Id: I4d6c6e5dbaaa6e9ff7fdb6f0c719ad3ae3645f15

commit_message:
Fix glance tempest plugin test to use the right tempest variables

A set of changes moved the glance specific bits to use the tempest
configuration option for detecting if the secure RBAC tests should be
run [0][1]. But, we didn't update the tests themselves to use the new option,
causing the tests to be skipped without our knowledge.

This commit updates the tests to use the new option and gets them
running again.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/778952
[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/778945

Change-Id: I01e0db7f0d79f072211ee63ea48a6558d008d285

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 20:02:43.000000000', 'message': 'Implement granular policy checks for volume type access policies

This commit deprecates the volume_extension:volume_type_access policy in
favor of more granular defaults.

This change makes it easier for us to implement support for a
project-reader and project-member role since each API policy can have an
appropriate default.

commit_message:
Implement granular policy checks for volume type access policies

This commit deprecates the volume_extension:volume_type_access policy in
favor of more granular defaults.

This change makes it easier for us to implement support for a
project-reader and project-member role since each API policy can have an
appropriate default.

Closes-Bug: 1841587

Change-Id: Id4c9050525cc54bc69d89e33ffbdebecb9a48938

commit_message:
Implement reader role support for default volume types

This commits updates the default policy for gettting volume types to
use the reader role, which is designated for read-only operations.

Change-Id: I822d48fb9908c735ae9e06c0b6908d21b14432a7

commit_message:
Describe system-scope work for administrative capabilities

The capabilities API is useful for deployment operators, making it a
good candidate to convert to the system-reader person.

This commit updates the policies with some comments that describe how we
can update the capabilities API when we have full system-scope support
in cinder.

Change-Id: Ibec61eeed821841af3fd4aa97e7c6939f07f4ed5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-27 21:59:32.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for group types API

This commit implements support for a read-only role and uses the
system-scope concept to protect the group types API. This is important
for providing a consistent and safe RBAC experience across OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ic10d4203f5aa32a061bf2f64bd4468d529747aaf
'}, {'created': '2020-11-18 15:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'Implement secure RBAC for group types API

This commit implements support for a read-only role and uses the
system-scope concept to protect the group types API. This is important
for providing a consistent and safe RBAC experience across OpenStack.

Change-Id: Ic10d4203f5aa32a061bf2f64bd4468d529747aaf
'}, {'created': '2021-02-16 22:56:28.000000000', 'message': 'Describe system-scope work for group types API

The group types API is useful for deployment operators, making it a good
candidate to convert to system persona.

This commit updates the policies with some comments that describe how we can
update the group types API when we have full system-scope support in cinder.

Change-Id: Ic10d4203f5aa32a061bf2f64bd4468d529747aaf
'}]
commit_message:
Describe system-scope work for group types API

The group types API is useful for deployment operators, making it a good
candidate to convert to system persona.

This commit updates the policies with some comments that describe how we can
update the group types API when we have full system-scope support in cinder.

Change-Id: Ic10d4203f5aa32a061bf2f64bd4468d529747aaf

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-17 20:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Implement granular policy checks for volume image metadata policies

This commit deprecates the volume_extension:volume_image_metadata policy
in favor of more granular defaults.

This makes it easier to support default roles, like `reader` and
`member` since each API can have an appropriate default.

Change-Id: I84e2388ace8c8986ec6a7bf96b6122c673222047
'}, {'created': '2021-02-17 20:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Implement granular policy checks for volume image metadata policies

This commit deprecates the volume_extension:volume_image_metadata policy
in favor of more granular defaults.

This makes it easier to support default roles, like `reader` and
`member` since each API can have an appropriate default.

Change-Id: I84e2388ace8c8986ec6a7bf96b6122c673222047
'}]
commit_message:
Implement granular policy checks for volume image metadata policies

This commit deprecates the volume_extension:volume_image_metadata policy
in favor of more granular defaults.

This makes it easier to support default roles, like `reader` and
`member` since each API can have an appropriate default.

Change-Id: I84e2388ace8c8986ec6a7bf96b6122c673222047

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for resetting group snapshots

This commit updates the policy for resetting a group snapshot to use the
new system-scope construct.

This is important for abstracting administrative operations to a
separate authorization target instead of overloading project-scope. This
will help provide a consistent and safer experience for users and
authorization.

Change-Id: Iea190082a821f90b332daec824d8271660981f07

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for administrative backup APIs

These APIs are specific to folks operating the deployment. We can update
the policies to use the system-admin and system-member personas here
instead of relying on legacy project-admin workarounds.

Change-Id: Iebd62082440aa7732f4fca68f391f35762faf6f0

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for worker API

The worker API is pretty much an API only for operators. This commit
updates the policies so that it uses the new system-scope construct from
keystone.

This is in line with a series of changes across OpenStack so that we
provide secure and consistent default policies.

Change-Id: I6a87f8fae8423f75e858aad6b431e83ef3779044

[{'created': '2021-08-23 18:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add run tests as thin provisioning

Some vendors might not have enough available space for testing features
that require creating huge volumes. So, this patch adds a new tempest
CONF `share_thin_provisioned` that could be used to create volumes
as thin provisioned during the test execution.

Change-Id: I646f782c3e2be5ac799254f08a248a22cb9e0358
'}, {'created': '2021-09-03 13:30:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add run tests as thin provisioning

Some vendors might not have enough available space for testing features
that require creating huge volumes. So, this patch adds a new tempest
CONF `capability_thin_provisioned` that could be used to create volumes
as thin provisioned during the test execution.

Change-Id: I646f782c3e2be5ac799254f08a248a22cb9e0358
'}]
commit_message:
Add run tests as thin provisioning

Some vendors might not have enough available space for testing features
that require creating huge volumes. So, this patch adds a new tempest
CONF `capability_thin_provisioned` that could be used to create volumes
as thin provisioned during the test execution.

Change-Id: I646f782c3e2be5ac799254f08a248a22cb9e0358

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for cinder hosts

This commit deprecates the policies for cinder hosts and introduces
system-scope instead.

This is inline with a series of patches to provide a more consistent and
safer authorization experience across OpenStack.

Change-Id: I56ed09914844a36dfb4e779582bc392236cdd02d

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for quota classes

The quota classes API is reserved for system-administrators, so we can
deprecated the existing policies and adopt system-scope instead.

Change-Id: I70ae6fe8e2c7cd4a68f41adab36a3ce0b94e995e

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for manageable snapshots

This commit converst the manageable snapshots API to use the
system-scope construct, which is an initiative to make authorization
safer and more secure across OpenStack.

This commit also adds support for a read-only role.

Change-Id: I3df1fc88a6a8018b47cce3e4b7422ce3df6526cd

commit_message:
Remove resource types to manage security groups and rules

The nova_security_group resource type and the nova_security_rule
resource type are dependent on subcommands of nova cli which were
already removed during Pike cycle[1][2]. This change removes these
invalid resource types.

Deprecation process is skipped because these resource types have not
worked as intended for a long period and we don't expect any user is
still using these invalid implementations.

[1] security group      : a298b29cc7e6b7330945b1890f0a4bd4c9f3fde6
[2] security groip rules: 0896bdc52a307c0b9598da0b6b837a95f0c00b9a

Closes-Bug: #1941947
Change-Id: Ic72911bab169b0ab171a1701b6871a3d03f7951b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 00:37:08.000000000', 'message': "Modify share server migration tests

This change modifies the behavior of some share server migration
tests. Since Xena release, after the share server migration is
completed, the share server will be always deleted.

Removes the code fragments that ensured that if a share server
existed, it should reach an 'inactive' state.

Signed-off-by: silvacarloss <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I43bd3fdafea02eb8e853114a57bfb863a441f3ed
"}]
commit_message:
Modify share server migration tests

This change modifies the behavior of some share server migration
tests. Since Xena release, after the share server migration is
completed, the share server will be always deleted.

Removes the code fragments that ensured that if a share server
existed, it should reach an 'inactive' state.

Signed-off-by: silvacarloss <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I43bd3fdafea02eb8e853114a57bfb863a441f3ed

I was able to reproduce the CI error in a standard master/centos8 deployment and it looks like the podman version inside the container is a bit different than the one running on the host, thus causing an API mismatch. [1]

This doesn't happen in a master/centos9 deployment, even though the container is centos8.

centos8 host: podman-3.0.1-6.module_el8.5.0+736+58cc1a5a.x86_64
centos8 container: podman-3.1.0-0.13.module_el8.5.0+733+9bb5dffa.x86_64


Basically, podman-3.1 will hit /v3.1.0-dev and podman-3.0 will hit /v2.0.0.

Still looking for a solution.

    [1]
    GET /v3.1.0-dev/libpod/_ping HTTP/1.1\r
    Host: d\r
    User-Agent: Go-http-client/1.1\r
    \r
    < 2021/07/16 11:38:49.163010  length=167 from=0 to=166
    HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r
    Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8\r
    X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff\r
    Date: Fri, 16 Jul 2021 11:38:49 GMT\r
    Content-Length: 10\r
    \r
    Not Found
    > 2021/07/16 11:39:09.068753  length=78 from=0 to=77
    GET /v2.0.0/libpod/_ping HTTP/1.1\r
    Host: d\r
    User-Agent: Go-http-client/1.1\r
    \r
    < 2021/07/16 11:39:09.229345  length=335 from=0 to=334
    HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would raise this up with the podman folks to explain this use case. new versions should be able to interact with old versions'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-16 14:01:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> I would raise this up with the podman folks to explain this use case. new versions should be able to interact with old versions

yeah that's what I thought as well, asked #podman on libera earlier but got no answer so I just opened this issue [1]

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/10963"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-07-17 05:25:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Apparently, this is fixed with this commit [1], so I made a test build for 3.1.1-1 [2], updated podman on the host and it worked.

[2] https://github.com/valleedelisle/rhosp-tools/tree/master/rpms/podman-3.1.1-1.el8'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-19 13:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

nice so we just need them to release it so it ends up in c9'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-19 13:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

we'll need to follow up this topic for neutron wrappers"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-07-23 07:26:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

...but I'm uncertain about adding yet another corner case of host vs container RPMs discrepancies, like we used to have for pacemaker"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-23 13:36:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

neutron wrappers don't use nsenter, but yea we can probably leverage --remote for some of it"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-07-26 07:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> neutron wrappers don't use nsenter, but yea we can probably leverage --remote for some of it

but they used to... What did I miss? I can only see the revert on the top: 
25cf1483 - Emilien Macchi, 1 year, 3 months ago : Revert "Remove neutron wrappers"
afe7cecb - Emilien Macchi, 1 year, 8 months ago : Remove neutron wrappers'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-07-26 07:05:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I recall there was also a revert of timers based wrappers in tripleo ansible, so what is the current deployment mode for those?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-26 13:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

yes we use them in puppet-tripleo but they do different things than the nova ones so --remote is an RFE and not a requirement for an upcoming bug'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-08-31 08:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

So from my testing with centos9-stream and crun nova_virtlogd_wrapper does not work without this change. I tried adding only https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/802531 to my env but it still does not work. Only adding this review makes it work.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-08-31 13:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-08-31 17:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This is failing because of the mismatched version of podman inside the container and on the host:
2021-08-31T15:20:55.356762977+00:00 stderr F Error: cannot connect to the Podman socket, please verify that Podman REST API service is running: server API version is too old. Client "3.1.0" server "3.0.0"

Based on this bz [1], this is addressed by podman-3.1.1. CentOS Stream 8.4 will be shipped with podman-3.2. The current CI runs podman-3.0.1-6.module_el8.5.0+736+58cc1a5a.x86_64.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1983719'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2021-09-01 08:16:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So in my testing now with updated podman + crun, I can spin up vms on my c9 standalone without this patch. I would try and avoid this change given that it risks introducing container/host coupling and we've seen how painful that is with pcmk."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-09-01 16:25:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:

> This is failing because of the mismatched version of podman inside the container and on the host:

ugh, does this patch bring that dependency of podman in container vs host?..'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-09-01 17:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-09-01 17:29:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

so, yes, please let's not introduce such a coupling of podman versions"}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-03 12:41:04.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: cs9'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-09-03 16:30:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This is no longer needed.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-13 22:37:47.000000000', 'message': "DNM [c9] nenter needs to enter the cgroup namespace

In centos-8, containers' libpod are under various system cgroups as
opposed to directly under machine.slice in centos-9.

This causes the nova_virtlog_wrapper to fail launching the virtlogd
container with nsenter unless we pass it -C switch to enter the cgroup.

Related-Bug: #1936005
Change-Id: I3d7c58fad9e4a477af955bdeca5be771de2a4782
"}, {'created': '2021-07-15 01:13:48.000000000', 'message': '[c9] replace nsenter with podman --remote

Since centos8 uses cgroupsv1 by default, and centos9 uses cgroupsv2,
we have to modify the nsenter arguments to enter the cgroup namespace.
Might as well leverage podman remote API.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/800848
Related-Bug: #1936005
Change-Id: I3d7c58fad9e4a477af955bdeca5be771de2a4782
'}, {'created': '2021-07-15 01:15:39.000000000', 'message': '[c9] replace nsenter with podman --remote

Since centos8 uses cgroupsv1 by default, and centos9 uses cgroupsv2,
we have to modify the nsenter arguments to enter the cgroup namespace.
Might as well leverage podman remote API.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/800848
Closes-Bug: #1936005
Change-Id: I3d7c58fad9e4a477af955bdeca5be771de2a4782
'}]
commit_message:
[c9] replace nsenter with podman --remote

Since centos8 uses cgroupsv1 by default, and centos9 uses cgroupsv2,
we have to modify the nsenter arguments to enter the cgroup namespace.
Might as well leverage podman remote API.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/800848
Closes-Bug: #1936005
Change-Id: I3d7c58fad9e4a477af955bdeca5be771de2a4782

commit_message:
Add reproducer for Project creation race bug

This patch adds a functional tests that reproduce the error

  sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError: This session is in 'inactive'
  state, due to the SQL transaction being rolled back; no further SQL
  can be emitted within this transaction.

that happens during two racing allocation update.

Co-Authored-By: melanie witt <melwittt@gmail.com>

Story: 2009159
Task: 43147

Change-Id: I80df62dae3a31481c71254e1054973df39bec955

commit_message:
Describe system-scope work for cluster API

The cluster API is useful for deployment operators, making it a good
candidate to convert to system persona.

This commit updates the policies with some comments that describe how we
can update the cluster API when we have full system-scope support in
cinder.

Change-Id: Ia6c67f47ca8d5f06cb14c224a2c69b366679d3fd

commit_message:
Implement project personas for volume action API

This commit updates the policies to use the default roles from keystone
be consistent with authorization across OpenStack.

Future patches will incorporate system scope when cinder supports it.

Change-Id: I5ede1fb96408ec0c5684bb2dbb46ed12a42c6b96

subject: Implement project personas for the messages API

commit_message:
Implement project personas for the messages API

This commit deprecates the current policies and makes them aware of
default roles provided by keystone. This is part of a broad change to
make authorization across OpenStack more secure.

Future changes will incorporate system scope policies when cinder fully
supports it.

Change-Id: I4748f258f331890af3077ccaced0ec6aedfc4e4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-03 14:56:39.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6b7c345706fbc0c257296273a5eaa406ccdf47e5
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6b7c345706fbc0c257296273a5eaa406ccdf47e5

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I1a2ed0695125b5d0733299f3efd263fe61868ee7

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-27 17:10:06.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid running tempest-full-ipv6 for unrelated tools files

Currently tempest-full-ipv6 job run on all the files change
present in /tools dir which is not required. For example
when we update the tempest plugin sanity scripts present in
/tools dir then this job run which is unneccessary.

Optimizing the tools dir file as per related job required to run.

Change-Id: Ia1d8a8a6dd22bec02e9f93598ddfd3d110b6c009
'}, {'created': '2021-08-27 17:26:28.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid running tempest-ipv6-only for unrelated tools files

Currently tempest-ipv6-only job run on all the files change
present in /tools dir which is not required. For example
when we update the tempest plugin sanity scripts present in
/tools dir then this job run which is unneccessary.

Optimizing the tools dir file as per related job required to run.

Change-Id: Ia1d8a8a6dd22bec02e9f93598ddfd3d110b6c009
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid running tempest-ipv6-only for unrelated tools files

Currently tempest-ipv6-only job run on all the files change
present in /tools dir which is not required. For example
when we update the tempest plugin sanity scripts present in
/tools dir then this job run which is unneccessary.

Optimizing the tools dir file as per related job required to run.

Change-Id: Ia1d8a8a6dd22bec02e9f93598ddfd3d110b6c009

commit_message:
[Train Only] Remove remaining puppet-monasca

This patch removes a left over about puppet-monasca which should have
been removed when we retired puppet-monasca.
Note that this patch is submitted to stable/train only, because
Puppetfile_centos8 was added to stable/train but was removed from
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Iee0673aa8d2de97cbeffac7261c001889a9dce19

subject: Fix the lvm_share_export_ips typo
messages:
[{'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2021-08-25 06:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2021-08-25 06:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-08-25 16:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Yes, [1] confirms it should be lvm_share_export_ips.

Is there a Launchpad bug for this? Having one (and referencing it in this patch) will facilitate backporting the fix.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/manila/share/drivers/lvm.py#L45'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2021-08-26 00:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1
> 
> Yes, [1] confirms it should be lvm_share_export_ips.
> 
> Is there a Launchpad bug for this? Having one (and referencing it in this patch) will facilitate backporting the fix.
> 
> [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/manila/share/drivers/lvm.py#L45

Thanks for confirming.
It is not a bug, just misuse deprecated parameter in the previous change. lvm_share_export_ip is deprecated in favor of lvm_share_export_ips https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/branch/master/releasenotes/notes/drop-support-for-lvm-share-export-ip-e031ef4c5f95b534.yaml'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-02 16:00:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:11:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Can we deprecate the parameter instead of directly rename it ?'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:28:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hmm... so this resource type was added during this cycle. So it might be just redundant to deprecate the parameter.
A small concern is that we created a release with the wrong parameter already, and adding a release note would be helpful. I'll add that one by my side soon."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26721, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:48:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> Hmm... so this resource type was added during this cycle. So it might be just redundant to deprecate the parameter.
> A small concern is that we created a release with the wrong parameter already, and adding a release note would be helpful. I'll add that one by my side soon.

Thanks Takashi"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-03 13:42:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-03 13:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2021-04-15 08:54:25.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Network delete performance

- pass existing network dict to PRECOMMIT_DELETE ml2 handler;
- skip MTU and segment update handling in case network is
  about to be deleted.

Above gives up to 50% net delete speed-up

Change-Id: I07c70db027f2ae03ffb5a95072e019e8a5fdc411
'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 10:06:36.000000000', 'message': 'Improve Network delete performance

- pass existing network dict to PRECOMMIT_DELETE ml2 handler;
- skip MTU and segment update handling in case network is
  about to be deleted.

Above gives up to 50% net delete speed-up

Change-Id: I07c70db027f2ae03ffb5a95072e019e8a5fdc411

commit_message:
Improve Network delete performance

- pass existing network dict to PRECOMMIT_DELETE ml2 handler;
- skip MTU and segment update handling in case network is
  about to be deleted.

Above gives up to 50% net delete speed-up

Change-Id: I07c70db027f2ae03ffb5a95072e019e8a5fdc411

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:51:36.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-cinderclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-cinderclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 8.0.0..f949080
f949080 Add consumes quota field support
d04ded6 Unset tempest.lib timeout in functional tests
14bb543 Dropping lower constraints testing

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2ff39287ed1cac0af0c6456866a0eba39b13a796
'}, {'created': '2021-09-03 14:04:36.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-cinderclient for Xena

Release cinderclient 8.1.0 and cut the stable/xena branch.

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2ff39287ed1cac0af0c6456866a0eba39b13a796
'}]
commit_message:
Release final python-cinderclient for Xena

Release cinderclient 8.1.0 and cut the stable/xena branch.

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I2ff39287ed1cac0af0c6456866a0eba39b13a796

prominent role loadbalancer, and moving also specific
templates to subdirectory.

This was done only to better diff in follow-up
changes.

commit_message:
Rename role haproxy to loadbalancer

For now role haproxy is maintaining haproxy
and keepalived. In follow-up changes there is also
proxysql added.

This patch is *only* renaming/moving stuff to more
prominent role loadbalancer, and moving also specific
templates to subdirectory.

This was done only to better diff in follow-up
changes.

Change-Id: I1d39d5bcaefc4016983bf267a2736b742cc3a555

commit_message:
Release final python-cloudkittyclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-cloudkittyclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 4.2.0..647f561
647f561 Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections
61ef2c3 Fix creation of hashmap mapping with a zero cost
eb7f5e4 Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0
0608c05 docs: Update Freenode to OFTC
754e06c setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
d12e5a8 [ussuri][goal] Update contributor documentation
d2c2323 Fix PDF docs build
67fae0f Use py3 as the default runtime for tox
73668be Add release notes job template
dc606b1 Add Python3 xena unit tests
5141971 Update master for stable/wallaby

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie80ba4cff4868485bee796bb81586a2702953c60

out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this

commit_message:
Support Block Storage API mv 3.66

Block Storage API mv 3.66 enables snapshots of in-use volumes
without requiring a 'force' flag.  For backward compatibility,
the API silently accepts force=true, even though the 'force' flag
is considered invalid for that call.  That behavior is replicated
in the client, where --force with a true value is silently accepted.
The --force option is not advertised in the shell and an option
value that doesn't evaluate to true raises an UnsupportedAttribute
error.  Similar behavior from the v3 Snapshot class, except it
raises a ValueError under similar circumstances.

Change-Id: I7408d0e3a5ed7f4cbcaf65cf3434ad60aaed511d

commit_message:
Don't allow to run train on centos7

This change will not allow to run the train on centos7.

Here we are going to migrate upstream stable/train jobs
from CentOS-7 to CentOS-8 [1] is close.
CentOS-7 stable/train will continue to be tested in our
3rd party periodic pipeline and builds of CentOS-7
stable/train will be qualified here [2][3].

Also we are keeping c7 multinode containers job to
maintain c7 coverage.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/738375
[2]: https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/builds?pipeline=openstack-periodic-integration-stable2-centos7
[3]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-July/016157.html

Change-Id: I9f274c3866b214373c3562b0d6b480d15df1ce37
Signed-off-by: Bhagyashri Shewale <bshewale@redhat.com>

subject: [Train only] Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-03 13:35:05.000000000', 'message': '[Train only] Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

Following the migration done in TripleO repos[1], this change replaces

commit_message:
[Train only] Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

Following the migration done in TripleO repos[1], this change replaces
usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1] 46d1aa9c5c8297f8c1854766f81b1143590536df

Change-Id: If7662157b4431ba4cf008cf832f846d9efd82ba0

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:57:52.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-manilaclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-manilaclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 2.7.0..2f173cb
2f173cb [OSC] Implement share instance commands
1d59127 [OSC] Add Share Snapshot Instances commands
2fc21c3 Fix incorrect dict member lookup
d566ecc [OSC] Implement Share Pools List command
376429e Add --wait flag to the create share group operation
ca00798 [OSC] Implement Replica Export Locations commands
fcbcf75 [OSC] Implement Share Services Commands
53275be [OSC] Implement Availability Zones Command
616f3ac Fix issue while creating share from snapshot
3c278d7 Fix PDF docs issue
6ecdbef Re-enable shell completion cache
adc5bc1 [OSC] Fix the default API_VERSION in unit tests
c5e2561 Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec
f84f32e Add --wait flag to the delete share group operation
eea1d21 tests: Remove unused fakes
0002625 utils: Remove unicode-related helpers
f6c747f tools: Remove dead tools
1562ec6 Remove six
f3d7927 Uncap PrettyTable
2a1fb2b Add "--wait" option for deleting a share server
8ad1583 Fix typo in quota set error message
df33886 [OSC] Implement Share Replica Commands
5220acf Changed minversion in tox to 3.18.0
de19027 Further fix to "test_list_shares_by_status"
931743a Remove some deprecated options

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8d585b46c92f835298ba1d3d1d8cc6a17d361af1

commit_message:
Trivial: better debugging in list_all_block_devices

One debug message only specified "Skipping" without any details.
Another did not log the whole line from lsblk. Fix both.

Change-Id: I9f8f4edad88ba2df5abc6a45a74ebdb3c7afcf97

[{'created': '2020-02-27 13:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Update charm creation guide for new charm snap

The OpenStack Charm Templates are now included in the core charm
snap so this is the only pre-requisite step required for creation
of all three types of OpenStack charm.

Change-Id: I9f5fdcd78c692b9603d8636bbd36e3bfbaef92bb

commit_message:
Update charm creation guide for new charm snap

The OpenStack Charm Templates are now included in the core charm
snap so this is the only pre-requisite step required for creation
of all three types of OpenStack charm.

Change-Id: I9f5fdcd78c692b9603d8636bbd36e3bfbaef92bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-14 22:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo-podman: Enable and start podman.socket

It might be a good idea to control wether or not the podman.socket
service is enabled in case we want to podman --remote.

We plan on using this in the wrapper services instead of relying on
nsenter.

Change-Id: I52d63d34a9c01bac7e77f2ce9154aa719b4f82b5
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-podman: Enable and start podman.socket

It might be a good idea to control wether or not the podman.socket
service is enabled in case we want to podman --remote.

We plan on using this in the wrapper services instead of relying on
nsenter.

Change-Id: I52d63d34a9c01bac7e77f2ce9154aa719b4f82b5

commit_message:
[c9] nova_libvirt with host's cgroupns

Based on related bz, nova_libvirt container should be started with
cgroupns set to host in Centos 9

Related-Bug: #1936005
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1985377
Change-Id: Id0c4505c794f8cbae331f0f569967739c82700eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-27 01:44:19.000000000', 'message': 'Convert features not supported error to HTTPBadRequest

There is inconsistency on return code nova API return
for "Feature not supported/implemented'. Current return
code are 400, 409, and 403.
- 400 case: Example: Multiattach Swap Volume Not Supported
- 403 case: Cyborg integration
- 409 case: Example: Operation Not Supported For SEV ,
  Operation Not Supported For VTPM

In xena PTG, we agreed to fix this by returning 400 in all cases
- L446: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-xena-ptg

This commit convert all the features not supported error to
HTTPBadRequest(400).

To avoid converting every NotSupported inherited exception
in API controller to HTTPBadRequest generic conversion is
added in expected_errors() decorator.

For consistency, inherit few more feature not supported exception
from Invalid to new exception class NotSupported(both are 400 so
no change in their return code).

Closes-Bug: #1938093
Change-Id: I410924668a73785f1bfe5c79827915d72e1d9e03

commit_message:
Convert features not supported error to HTTPBadRequest

There is inconsistency on return code nova API return
for "Feature not supported/implemented'. Current return
code are 400, 409, and 403.
- 400 case: Example: Multiattach Swap Volume Not Supported
- 403 case: Cyborg integration
- 409 case: Example: Operation Not Supported For SEV ,
  Operation Not Supported For VTPM

In xena PTG, we agreed to fix this by returning 400 in all cases
- L446: https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/nova-xena-ptg

This commit convert all the features not supported error to
HTTPBadRequest(400).

To avoid converting every NotSupported inherited exception
in API controller to HTTPBadRequest generic conversion is
added in expected_errors() decorator.

Closes-Bug: #1938093

Change-Id: I410924668a73785f1bfe5c79827915d72e1d9e03

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 14:04:47.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-tackerclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-tackerclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.7.0..6325127
6325127 Remove use of testtools.helpers.safe_hasattr
e8280f5 Remove broken link from Python-TackerClient guide
94e28fc Correct YAML load warning
c20ef24 vnfConfigurableProperties missing in VNF show
4c59029 Update min version of tox

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I82ebacef170592867182de6ecf7e8176447cdaa6
'}, {'created': '2021-09-03 06:11:05.000000000', 'message': 'Release final python-tackerclient for Xena

commit_message:
Release final python-tackerclient for Xena

This proposed a release for python-tackerclient to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Xena going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.7.0..98789f8
98789f8 Multi version API support
6325127 Remove use of testtools.helpers.safe_hasattr
e8280f5 Remove broken link from Python-TackerClient guide
94e28fc Correct YAML load warning
c20ef24 vnfConfigurableProperties missing in VNF show
4c59029 Update min version of tox

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I82ebacef170592867182de6ecf7e8176447cdaa6

commit_message:
Extend fencing to hosts using fence_kubevirt agent.

This commit extends the fencing class allowing operators to use
fence_kubevirt for nodes running on kubevirt / CNV.

Depends-On: I18fd2297063c7157d6b743c7fc9c161bf23dca39
Change-Id: I4f4658b3320c2cce2cf302dbb5f99bb463bd22ca
(cherry picked from commit 90005dd883ed7cacb1f446717a1d8c97520a6d8c)

commit_message:
Improve edge-case debugging for deployment and cleaning

* Log traceback in fail_on_error
  This is a last-resort error handler, it needs to log traceback.
* Use an assertion when we expect a present list of steps
* Log the freshly build list of steps.

Change-Id: I8cd4cd330551b7bc9a44957e0d15c8b75c09c299

With glance supporting multiple stores we need to update glance_pool
so that it explores the content of GlanceMultistoreConfig to see if
any of the configured backends are of rbd type.

We also add a the CephClusterName parameter into the CI rbd_store
multistore for Glance, which is a mandatory parameter to correctly

commit_message:
Consider GlanceMultistoreConfig when setting glance_pool

With glance supporting multiple stores we need to update glance_pool
so that it explores the content of GlanceMultistoreConfig to see if
any of the configured backends are of rbd type.

We also add a the CephClusterName parameter into the CI rbd_store
multistore for Glance, which is a mandatory parameter to correctly
set the permissions on the keyring files of every Ceph cluster.

Co-Authored-By: Yatin Karel <ykarel@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Iee670befb2bcbaa2b666c6b99f5153391b62049e
(cherry picked from commit 151ca15e81799606972d9fe7ad65107dfde5a427)

commit_message:
Use to network-v2 fs001, fs002, fs020, fs039

Update the jobs to use network-v2, deploying networks
and ports prior to the heat stack.

Also stop using CI specific NIC templates, the default
multi-nic example templates should just work with the OVB
setup so it's good if we cover them in tests.

Related-Bug: #1934669
Related-Bug: #1904894
Change-Id: I8dbc3f088aad8f74aef829a4f4c9c369eb6dd951

commit_message:
Ensure ephemeral heat not used in old releases

tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset002-upload-stein
fails with:
 openstack overcloud deploy:
  error:
    unrecognized arguments: --heat-type pod

We should not use ephemeral heat for pre-Wallaby releases.

Closes-Bug: #1935672
Change-Id: I7fc7674b1c15332200eed124414b07fd5b1213bf

subject: Set empty nodepool resource lists on inap
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-02 19:01:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-09-02 19:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-09-03 10:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 19:01:04.000000000', 'message': 'Set empty nodepool resource lists on inap

This is the next step in cleaning up the inap provider. We set empty
resources lists in nodepool config for the inap provider so that
nodepool will automatically clean up after itself.

Change-Id: I4ff2bd2e1705cdedd2832254b0589b7bb367629b
'}]
commit_message:
Set empty nodepool resource lists on inap

This is the next step in cleaning up the inap provider. We set empty
resources lists in nodepool config for the inap provider so that
nodepool will automatically clean up after itself.

Change-Id: I4ff2bd2e1705cdedd2832254b0589b7bb367629b

final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Thursday, September 02.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 17.5.0..8066f8c7
8066f8c7 Microversion 2.90 - Configurable hostnames
01c7a3aa tests: Add missing 'nova update' unit tests
4a5bdde3 Add pre-commit
cfa172c4 Microversion 2.89 - os-volume_attachments
bff8d413 Use importlib instead of imp
273c4157 Use Block Storage API v3 instead of API v2

Signed-off-by: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If850205d0334205ca5c5e79c8f992b6bf386ed64

case we have a specific version (python-version for instance).

commit_message:
Allow to pass arbitrary parameters to TCIB image config

This new parameter takes key=value format, and can be passed multiple
times.

Those key/values can then be used within the image description files in
order to make them support different releases, or just use the value in
case we have a specific version (python-version for instance).

This will be useful in order to support container builds on both CS8 and
CS9 releases without too many duplications or headaches.

Note that a "tcib_" prefix is enforced for the keys.

Change-Id: I7fe4d59f1fb76ba59d065b56c5900f4d3cfcda2e

commit_message:
Support interface attach / detach with new resource request format

The interface attach and detach logic is now fully adapted to the new
extended resource request format, and supports more than one request
group in a single port.

blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate
Change-Id: I73e6acf5adfffa9203efa3374671ec18f4ea79eb

commit_message:
Make service_type configurable

Currently puppet-nova hard-codes service type while the other modules
generally provide the corresponding parameters.
This change introduces the new service_type parameter to customize
service type to provide the consistent interface.

Change-Id: I2d6f01dd6b6b32bc6a57c77b2896b6976efadeb7

'}, {'created': '2021-09-02 11:26:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix molecule job for tripleo_ha_wrapper

It currently is failing with:
TASK [test_deps : Install tripleo packages] ************************************
fatal: [ubi8]: FAILED! => changed=false
  failures: []
  msg: |-
    Unknown Error occured: Transaction test error:
      file /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-release from install of containers-common-2:1-2.module_el8.5.0+890+6b136101.noarch conflicts with file from package redhat-release-8.2-1.0.el8.x86_64
  rc: 1
  results: []

That is because we're using stream stuff with ubi 8.2 images

Let's move to the same image as most other roles and also take
the test_deps_setup_* variables from whatever is being set globally.

Change-Id: Ib2a5f5a7a160398fdd9718e364bf50a383b9b9d5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix molecule job for tripleo_ha_wrapper

It currently is failing with:
TASK [test_deps : Install tripleo packages] ************************************
fatal: [ubi8]: FAILED! => changed=false
  failures: []
  msg: |-
    Unknown Error occured: Transaction test error:
      file /etc/pki/rpm-gpg/RPM-GPG-KEY-redhat-release from install of containers-common-2:1-2.module_el8.5.0+890+6b136101.noarch conflicts with file from package redhat-release-8.2-1.0.el8.x86_64
  rc: 1
  results: []

That is because we're using stream stuff with ubi 8.2 images

Let's move to the same image as most other roles and also take
the test_deps_setup_* variables from whatever is being set globally.

Change-Id: Ib2a5f5a7a160398fdd9718e364bf50a383b9b9d5

commit_message:
Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.

Change-Id: I162cea3b64e6c933f0c605e14ab8820f218b87ac

commit_message:
Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.

Change-Id: I293c28cc9e7decc2149b44b8f9154f088ebf09db

commit_message:
Allow to pass the release version as parameter

This will allow, in TCIB itself, to have better support for per-release
packages and related things.

Later, we'll be able to do some "if tcib_release > 9" and the like.

Note that this new parameter is an INT, so it expects a major release,
such as 8, 9. "8.4" won't do.

Change-Id: Ia5a42151f09d0117fe0e92be3987232b5b1d141c

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-05 09:10:19.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If591a633ecc4aa58b5824e0cf79c0f168ed0dd8d
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: If591a633ecc4aa58b5824e0cf79c0f168ed0dd8d

Enable the glance-simplestreams-sync charm to be configured to only
use internal endpoints, removing the requirement that the charm
access APIs via the public network.

This introduces a new option use-internal-endpoints, which is in-line
with other openstack charms which can be configured to use the internal
endpoints rather than public endpoints.

This option will only be valid for Keystone v3 API versions, which
should not be problematic as the v2 API has been deprecated for quite

commit_message:
Add use-internal-endpoints as a new config option

Enable the glance-simplestreams-sync charm to be configured to only
use internal endpoints, removing the requirement that the charm
access APIs via the public network.

This introduces a new option use-internal-endpoints, which is in-line
with other openstack charms which can be configured to use the internal
endpoints rather than public endpoints.

This option will only be valid for Keystone v3 API versions, which
should not be problematic as the v2 API has been deprecated for quite
some time now.

Closes-Bug: #1896438
Change-Id: I6d83a5469c34c2add3c1bc4ac5052be6d51ed343

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.
