commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml

Change-Id: If1ab96a8b78f47e3316c0a05b27f7827a27ab559

commit_message:
Implement project personas for metadef properties

This commit updates the policies for metadef properties
to use default roles available from keystone.

Implements: blueprint secure-rbac
Change-Id: Ic93c2a8a7017e6eac16d23fb5a9224d2c11e7211

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 09:20:15.000000000', 'message': '[tcib]Added python-version parameter

tcib tool is used for building openstack container images on different
EL distro versions.

Each EL distro version ships different python version and within tcib
config, we specify the python version in file path.

By using this parameter, we no longer needs to hardcode 3.6 or 3.9 in
the tcib config.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58644cb26956fbbee1c22a2e90f501adf176c2d2
'}]
commit_message:
[tcib]Added python-version parameter

tcib tool is used for building openstack container images on different
EL distro versions.

Each EL distro version ships different python version and within tcib
config, we specify the python version in file path.

By using this parameter, we no longer needs to hardcode 3.6 or 3.9 in
the tcib config.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I58644cb26956fbbee1c22a2e90f501adf176c2d2

Implement project personas for metadef resource-types

This commit updates the policies for metadef resource types
to use default roles available from keystone.

Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

Change-Id: I9c3e45adb2b969f498313cfb739f174d148c2c7d

TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

Change-Id: Ib913f0fe20af74c9a21875c6a7b497dfa2c30880
(cherry picked from commit 6bb2ecec0f0226fb7e9b57b37fc63ca4e544fdd3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-23 17:32:39.000000000', 'message': "Add two new hacking rules

As the bug and fix If71620e808744736cb4fe3abda76d81a6335311b showed
it is dangerous to forget instantiating the Mock class before it is
used in the test as changes on the class directly leaks out from the
test. In almost all the cases using Mock class directly is a bug and the
author original intention is to use an instance instead, just forgot
about the parents. So this patch adds two new hacking rules:

N367: catches the case when Mock class is aliased in the test:
    self.mock_mystuff = mock.Mock

N368: catches when mock.patch instructed to use the Mock class as
replacement value during patching:
    mock.patch('Bar.foo', new=mock.Mock)

For N367 the previous patch removed the last hit. For N368 this patch
removes the two hits exists.

Change-Id: Id42ca571b1569886ef47aa350369e9d2068e77bc
Related-Bug: #1936849

test. In almost all the cases using Mock class directly is a bug and the
author original intention is to use an instance instead, just forgot
about the parents. So this patch adds two new hacking rules:

N367: catches the case when Mock class is aliased in the test:
    self.mock_mystuff = mock.Mock

N368: catches when mock.patch instructed to use the Mock class as
replacement value during patching:
    mock.patch('Bar.foo', new=mock.Mock)

For N367 the previous patch removed the last hit. For N368 this patch
removes the two hits exists.

Change-Id: Id42ca571b1569886ef47aa350369e9d2068e77bc
Related-Bug: #1936849

commit_message:
Add two new hacking rules

As the bug and fix If71620e808744736cb4fe3abda76d81a6335311b showed
it is dangerous to forget instantiating the Mock class before it is
used in the test as changes on the class directly leaks out from the
test. In almost all the cases using Mock class directly is a bug and the
author original intention is to use an instance instead, just forgot
about the parents. So this patch adds two new hacking rules:

N367: catches the case when Mock class is aliased in the test:
    self.mock_mystuff = mock.Mock

N368: catches when mock.patch instructed to use the Mock class as
replacement value during patching:
    mock.patch('Bar.foo', new=mock.Mock)

For N367 the previous patch removed the last hit. For N368 this patch
removes the two hits exists.

Change-Id: Id42ca571b1569886ef47aa350369e9d2068e77bc
Related-Bug: #1936849

commit_message:
Add dnsmasq to ironic-pxe container

In order for us to handle RHEL9's removal of tftp-server, we need
to migrate to another TFTP server to support PXE operations, and
luckily enough, dnsmasq has this capability.

With the package in place, we should be able to invoke it
for the container to run and then eventually remove tftp-server.

Change-Id: I28a3e1200567236d4f78bfddb7899490bbea267f
(cherry picked from commit d3a5fdb6d0334eb74965c529c8d9c02a76ed8de1)

commit_message:
Make service_type configurable

Currently puppet-swift hard-codes service type while the other modules
generally provide the corresponding parameters.
This change introduces the new service_type parameter to customize
service type to provide the consistent interface.

Change-Id: Idbac284a06376f42a07f0f82ce6e595564d27fbf

commit_message:
Multi version API support

Add version '2' for support version of --os-tacker-api-version to
'openstack vnflcm' CLI.

If '--os-tacker-api-version 2' is specified, REST API url
'/vnflcm/v2' is used instead of '/vnflcm/v1'.

New CLI 'openstack vnflcm versions' is added too.

Implements: blueprint multi-version-api
Change-Id: I256a4010043d0b84ffe43b055c6a6a67a2d5d661

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

commit_message:
Restore kernel and ramdisk arguments to node configure

this change fixing a bug with "openstack overcloud node configure" cli. running the mentioned
command with or without "--deploy-kernel" "--deploy-ramdisk" will result with baremetals which does
not have any kernel and ramdisk setted

Change-Id: Iba653b7990d26041bde2f725b99a68c96c803ff1
Closes-Bug: #1939624
(cherry picked from commit a3c726c2267c505e1d8f7e69b9f08c906cc9cdf6)

subject: Fix the default of cinder::api::ratelimits_factory
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 09:07:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 09:09:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 11:33:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-28 01:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-08-28 19:40:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

The code changes certainly look fine, but I'm not familiar with RateLimitingMiddleware and so I'm curious to learn why it was available for API v1 and v2, but not v3."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-28 23:35:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm not able to explain the actual decision behind this unfortunately... but looking at the old, old git logs I found nova first removed that when API micro versions were added.
 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/115893

So my guess is cinder folks followed the same decision when they started implementing v3 API which has been supporting micro versions from the beginning."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-08-31 19:00:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

It's true that cinder has no RateLimitingMiddleware in its api/v3/limits.py. However, I've gone over the history of that file, and it still relies on the api/v2/limits.py content. From what I can tell, much of the content is actually unrelated to the API version, especially the RateLimitingMiddleware portion. And the api/v2/limits.py still exists in the tree, even with the actual API v2 code removed.

Digging further, much of the rate limiting seems to date back to the early days (2012-2013), and I have no idea if anyone uses the feature these days (tripleo doesn't configure it). But before we deprecate support in puppet, the feature would need to be deprecated in cinder. And from what I can see, it's OK to use the RateLimitingMiddleware in api/v2/limits.py, even for the API v3.

The one problem I _do_ see with the puppet code is it defaults ratelimits_factory to 'cinder.api.v1.limits:RateLimitingMiddleware.factory', which definitely won't work because the api/v1/limits.py file was removed a long time ago.

I suspect nobody is really using the rate limiting feature. I think we can go two ways with this:

1. Abandon this patch, and ask the cinder community if they really want to deprecate rate limiting (if they do, then maybe confirm the intent is to continue using the RateLimitingMiddleware in api/v2/limits.py).

2. Submit a different patch (or reuse this one) to update the ratelimits_factory default value to use the v2 factory, 'cinder.api.v2.limits:RateLimitingMiddleware.factory'"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-31 23:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-31 23:47:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-31 23:53:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Alan,

Thank you for your nice insight as always. I was confused with my observation for two projects about the same topic. It's true that the implementation is still left in cinder. As long as the implementation is left, we should not deprecated the parameter, so I've updated this change to only fix the wrong default.

IMHO the middleware is not really popular. It is not enabled in pipeline by default nowadays, nova dropped the same implementation, So it would make sense to deprecate the middleware from cinder as well. I'll look into that when I have time ( in case you are interested, please feel free to take it over :-) )."}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:00:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Agree that nobody is probably using it, but until it's removed from Cinder it makes sense to not have anything broken by default."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:16:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Yeah, this is a good fix. The cinder community is pretty overloaded (especially at the moment, with xena-m3 looming), so I don't expect cinder will have bandwidth to consider deprecating support for this in their code any time soon."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-09-02 23:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Fix the default of cinder::api::ratelimits_factory

The cinder::api class introduces RateLimitingMiddleware when
the ratelimits parameter is true. However the current default of
ratelimits_factory still points to v1 API code which was already
removed, and this results in an invalid definition.

This change ensures that it points to v2 API code which still exists.

Closes-Bug: #1941860
Change-Id: I97d14585ebb28166c95755169df0ea5433adb3e8

[{'created': '2021-09-01 22:00:30.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Fix edit authorized_keys file in-place

This fix is to avoid the issue described in #1942356
Cloud-init may not give permissions to the entire .ssh directory
which breaks sed --in-place operation, since it always create a
temporary file in the same directory.
New releases already use ssh-admin playbook instead of shell
commands.

Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix edit authorized_keys file in-place

This fix is to avoid the issue described in #1942356
Cloud-init may not give permissions to the entire .ssh directory
which breaks sed --in-place operation, since it always create a
temporary file in the same directory.
New releases already use ssh-admin playbook instead of shell
commands.

Closes-Bug: #1942356
Change-Id: If2db45f09eface56b5b26646b97e1fdbfb7b5a3e
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <dviroel@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-08-18 14:09:31.000000000', 'message': 'Do not fail when releasing a quota reservation

The quota reservation release (deletion) is done at the end of a
server call to create a new resource (or resources). The quota
drivers implemented have mechanisms to clean up the expired
reservations when calculating the resource quota.

If a reservation deletion fails, the API call should not be retried.
Instead of this, the reservation should be left and collected by
the quota driver clean up mechanisms.

This patch also adds a timeout delay for expired reservations in
``DbQuotaNoLockDriver``. Now this driver deletes any existing
reservation created ``RESERVATION_EXPIRATION_TIMEOUT = 20`` (seconds)
before. It is assumed that any reservation should be released before
this time (regardless if the resource is created or not).

Closes-Bug: #1940311

Change-Id: I155c401ec5e2fe6e3af6390855852764ee983cf5

commit_message:
Do not fail when releasing a quota reservation

The quota reservation release (deletion) is done at the end of a
server call to create a new resource (or resources). The quota
drivers implemented have mechanisms to clean up the expired
reservations when calculating the resource quota.

If a reservation deletion fails, the API call should not be retried.
Instead of this, the reservation should be left and collected by
the quota driver clean up mechanisms.

This patch also adds a timeout delay for expired reservations in
``DbQuotaNoLockDriver``. Now this driver deletes any existing
reservation created ``RESERVATION_EXPIRATION_TIMEOUT = 20`` (seconds)
before. It is assumed that any reservation should be released before
this time (regardless if the resource is created or not).

Closes-Bug: #1940311

Change-Id: I155c401ec5e2fe6e3af6390855852764ee983cf5

commit_message:
Implement project personas for metadef objects

This commit updates the policies for metadef objects to
use default roles available from keystone.

Implements: blueprint secure-rbac
Change-Id: If2001ef652e21f54048db0fc67893337681a2b6f

messages:
[{'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-08-16 08:44:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-08-19 10:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Review-Priority+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-08-24 09:34:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-08-31 16:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-08-31 16:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

There is a bug in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/801453/4/neutron/db/l3_db.py#1438: the patch changes events.AFTER_UPDATE with events.AFTER_CREATE. This is why "floatingip_update_callback" is never called.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-08-31 17:00:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> There is a bug in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/801453/4/neutron/db/l3_db.py#1438: the patch changes events.AFTER_UPDATE with events.AFTER_CREATE. This is why "floatingip_update_callback" is never called.

That comment was not for this patch, sorry.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-09-02 03:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I want to mention something that, not related to this patch, many times new feature is going to added to neutron, it will need to wait for neutron-lib to release. Then updating the neutron requirements, rotating the neutron patch, and wating... Since the big tent of networking projects are mostly going to retired, like networking-vpn, fwaas, lbaas and so on, can we move the neutron-lib related change to neutron first? If some sub-project is really wants this/that constants or exceptions, do it that time. I don't think a new feature is directly relied on. So can we make the neutron develop cycle more smoothly? For new hands of Neutron, this is something like to set barriers for new neutron developers. They want to contribute to Neutron, but their patiences are going to be consumed by the complex and tedious waiting/rotating/updating processes.

Actually, "do not toach neutron-lib", this what I ask our private developers to do so. We do not want to update neutron everytime with a long list of dependencies. Ideas?'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-09-02 07:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I want to mention something that, not related to this patch, many times new feature is going to added to neutron, it will need to wait for neutron-lib to release. Then updating the neutron requirements, rotating the neutron patch, and wating... Since the big tent of networking projects are mostly going to retired, like networking-vpn, fwaas, lbaas and so on, can we move the neutron-lib related change to neutron first? If some sub-project is really wants this/that constants or exceptions, do it that time. I don't think a new feature is directly relied on. So can we make the neutron develop cycle more smoothly? For new hands of Neutron, this is something like to set barriers for new neutron developers. They want to contribute to Neutron, but their patiences are going to be consumed by the complex and tedious waiting/rotating/updating processes.
> 
> Actually, "do not toach neutron-lib", this what I ask our private developers to do so. We do not want to update neutron everytime with a long list of dependencies. Ideas?

Sounds like a topic for the October PTG ;) 
I agree this is painful. Maybe we could add a "neutron_lib_staging" subdirectory to main neutron repo and add there all stuff needed for new in-progress features with same files and structures as in original neutron_lib. Once feature(s) is(are) ready/tested/stable - neutron_lib_staging could be copy-pasted to neutron_lib in one shot. This could be even done once before release for all features added during release. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-09-02 14:34:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I want to mention something that, not related to this patch, many times new feature is going to added to neutron, it will need to wait for neutron-lib to release. Then updating the neutron requirements, rotating the neutron patch, and wating... Since the big tent of networking projects are mostly going to retired, like networking-vpn, fwaas, lbaas and so on, can we move the neutron-lib related change to neutron first? If some sub-project is really wants this/that constants or exceptions, do it that time. I don't think a new feature is directly relied on. So can we make the neutron develop cycle more smoothly? For new hands of Neutron, this is something like to set barriers for new neutron developers. They want to contribute to Neutron, but their patiences are going to be consumed by the complex and tedious waiting/rotating/updating processes.
> 
> Actually, "do not toach neutron-lib", this what I ask our private developers to do so. We do not want to update neutron everytime with a long list of dependencies. Ideas?

You can always:
- Implement some code sections in Neutron with a NOTE to rehome it to neutron-lib.
- Use the depends-on trigger.

I don't see any problem with the current architecture.'}, {'account_id': 32667, 'date': '2021-09-02 17:21:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-09-03 01:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > I want to mention something that, not related to this patch, many times new feature is going to added to neutron, it will need to wait for neutron-lib to release. Then updating the neutron requirements, rotating the neutron patch, and wating... Since the big tent of networking projects are mostly going to retired, like networking-vpn, fwaas, lbaas and so on, can we move the neutron-lib related change to neutron first? If some sub-project is really wants this/that constants or exceptions, do it that time. I don't think a new feature is directly relied on. So can we make the neutron develop cycle more smoothly? For new hands of Neutron, this is something like to set barriers for new neutron developers. They want to contribute to Neutron, but their patiences are going to be consumed by the complex and tedious waiting/rotating/updating processes.
> > 
> > Actually, "do not toach neutron-lib", this what I ask our private developers to do so. We do not want to update neutron everytime with a long list of dependencies. Ideas?
> 
> You can always:
> - Implement some code sections in Neutron with a NOTE to rehome it to neutron-lib.
> - Use the depends-on trigger.
> 
> I don't see any problem with the current architecture.

No, it has problems as I mentioned above. Here are some examples:
1. Since the qos "VALID_RULE_TYPES" is moved to neutron-lib, we have done some extra works:
  a. copy the new list back, do the Neutron only development works [1].
  b. move the list back to neutron-lib [2]
  c. waiting for neutron-lib to have a new release [3]
  d. update neutron to use constants from neutron-lib  [4]

2. They are going to move the "*_BR_ALL_TABLES" to neutron-lib [5], and doing the same work of rotating Neutron [6]. For these tables, at least two WIP features will have works on these tables [7][8]. So, let them copy these list back to neutron again? Then add a TODO node? It wastes not only developer time, but also code reviewers bandwidth.

Again, since big tent projects are almost retired. If there are constants really needed by sub-projects, it is fine to move those to neutron-lib. Otherwise, leave Neutron used ONLY constants to neutron.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/796363/15/neutron/services/qos/constants.py
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lib/+/804378
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/803462
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804380
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797121/8/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/common/constants.py#b1
[6] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797120/
[7] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/797798/12/specs/xena/node-local-ip.rst@259
[8] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/804213'}]

commit_message:
Fix OSC share groups

Some issues were identified in the commit
that added share groups OSC commands in
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-manilaclient/+/801740

We were also missing an import.

Change-Id: If72f4ecafd6c986f44b769fc47970374da9c008b
Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2021-07-08 17:16:43.000000000', 'message': '[func test]Refactor interface attach with qos

To make the existing negative detach test more generic the logic is
changed from increasing the resource request of the port over the
resource inventory to decrease the resource inventory below the port
request. This is needed as the way to increasing the port request will
be different when the extended resource request extension is enabled.

Change-Id: Iec9d3bb4fef7b6b18a13517872f46afcce02520c

commit_message:
[func test] refactor interface attach with qos

To make the existing negative detach test more generic the logic is
changed from increasing the resource request of the port over the
resource inventory to decrease the resource inventory below the port
request. This is needed as the way to increasing the port request will
be different when the extended resource request extension is enabled.

Change-Id: Iec9d3bb4fef7b6b18a13517872f46afcce02520c
blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-26 15:54:30.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Document Network Availability Zones

This patch adds the documentation to the Network Availability Zones
support in OVN. Instead of having two documentation pages, one for router
AZs and another one for network AZs, this patch merges both guides into
one single documentation. Setting up AZs in OVN is the same for both
types and the differences between the two are documented within their
own sections.

The patch also removes a limitation listed in the SR-IOV documentation
for OVN since we no longer have a default HA Chassis Group. This
limitation was removed as part of the Network AZ work.

Change-Id: I55f27a5473dcd1e6e2255007108c2008acfb6dec
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Document Network Availability Zones

This patch adds the documentation to the Network Availability Zones
support in OVN. Instead of having two documentation pages, one for router
AZs and another one for network AZs, this patch merges both guides into
one single documentation. Setting up AZs in OVN is the same for both
types and the differences between the two are documented within their
own sections.

The patch also removes a limitation listed in the SR-IOV documentation
for OVN since we no longer have a default HA Chassis Group. This
limitation was removed as part of the Network AZ work.

Change-Id: I55f27a5473dcd1e6e2255007108c2008acfb6dec
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With monitor-all option, all ovn-controllers
do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.

Conflicts:
	manifests/controller.pp

Partial-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia78c0873e7ac6488b3048ae8475cc87ec40022bb
(cherry picked from commit 7a1bb545198d8c864c619b30f4bc13417d764bbd)

commit_message:
[CI] Fix periodic publish of centos8 images

kolla-publish-centos8 jobs (non-stream8) have been failing on
stable/victoria with the following error: 'base_tag' is undefined. This
is because the base_tag variable is only defined for centos8s jobs in
.zuul.d/centos.yaml.

Fix by checking if base_tag is defined.

Change-Id: Iad118c9885b2134a7d071a6629a2f3e3ae3d101e

commit_message:
[OSC] Implement Share Group Commands

Added the implementation of the share group commands to OSC.
Commands are:

- openstack share group create
- openstack share group delete
- openstack share group list
- openstack share group show
- openstack share group set
- openstack share group unset

Change-Id: I9eb31449fef4eae73f1db91f2bad133d0fe8df2e

subject: [DNM] Revert python-blazarclient to 3.2.0 for testing

Currently, multinode-legacy job in Zuul FT fail and shows following error log:
```
ft1.1: tacker.tests.functional.legacy.vnfm.test_tosca_vnf_reservation.VnfTestReservationMonitor.test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservationtesttools.testresult.real._StringException: pythonlogging:'': {{{2021-08-31 15:23:05,503 73222 WARNING  [keystoneauth.identity.base] Plugin cannot return an endpoint without knowing the service type that is required. Add service_type to endpoint filtering data.}}}

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/tacker/tests/functional/legacy/vnfm/test_tosca_vnf_reservation.py", line 224, in test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation
    instance_reservation, blazar_host = self._get_instance_reservation()
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/tacker/tests/functional/legacy/vnfm/test_tosca_vnf_reservation.py", line 197, in _get_instance_reservation
    blazar_host = blazarclient.host.create(
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/blazarclient/v1/hosts.py", line 27, in create
    resp, body = self.request_manager.post('/os-hosts', body=values)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/keystoneauth1/adapter.py", line 401, in post
    return self.request(url, 'POST', **kwargs)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/blazarclient/base.py", line 117, in request
    resp, body = super(SessionClient, self).request(
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/keystoneauth1/adapter.py", line 554, in request
    resp = super(LegacyJsonAdapter, self).request(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/keystoneauth1/adapter.py", line 257, in request
    return self.session.request(url, method, **kwargs)
  File "/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/tacker/.tox/dsvm-functional-legacy/lib/python3.8/site-packages/keystoneauth1/session.py", line 815, in request
    raise exceptions.EndpointNotFound()
keystoneauth1.exceptions.catalog.EndpointNotFound: Could not find requested endpoint in Service Catalog.
```

commit_message:
[DNM] Revert python-blazarclient to 3.2.0 for testing

This is a test patch to make sure that the current cause of Zuul-1 is
a python-blazarclient update to 3.3.0 from 3.2.0.

https: //pypi.org/project/python-blazarclient/3.3.0/#history
Change-Id: I34710d3b37dcc3be2ac1cb76b484e0d06583e3ef

commit_message:
[DNM] Fix ft error caused by updated blazarclient

The following patch for python-blazarclient have been merged in Aug 27
to change the parameter specification for blazarclient initialization.
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-blazarclient/+/781592

This patch changes the blazarclient initialization parameter in the
functional test code accordingly.

Change-Id: Ic0592811f77b1da6b16b488ca157c6ae62530184

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for qos specs API

This commit deprecates the existing policies and replaces them with the
equivalent system-scope policies. It also introduces a read-only role.

Change-Id: I7b9ec1ab1ce43cdd5b679ddc0e856be769e93fac

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 23:10:33.000000000', 'message': 'Only consider mounted OSD directories

When gathering the list of local OSD ids, the charm would consider
the entries under '/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-XXX' where 'XXX" was the
OSD id. However, if an entry under that directory isn't mounted,
then the OSD that would represent that entry should be discarded,
as it's no longer active. This patchset thus filters those entries
by looking for them in the mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1934938
Change-Id: I7ca84ef0b73620fe69d309546c746933e95ceb03
'}]
commit_message:
Only consider mounted OSD directories

When gathering the list of local OSD ids, the charm would consider
the entries under '/var/lib/ceph/osd/ceph-XXX' where 'XXX" was the
OSD id. However, if an entry under that directory isn't mounted,
then the OSD that would represent that entry should be discarded,
as it's no longer active. This patchset thus filters those entries
by looking for them in the mount points.

Closes-Bug: #1934938
Change-Id: I7ca84ef0b73620fe69d309546c746933e95ceb03

commit_message:
nit: Clarify how check() is different from enforce()

Outside of reading the code, there isn't anything in the documentation
that tells me the difference between check() and enforce().

Change-Id: I040b77f08e3d84875b060c5413a5195c7f954e77

[{'created': '2021-08-22 09:54:13.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused variables in tripleo::profile::base::gnocchi

commit_message:
Remove unused variables in tripleo::profile::base::gnocchi

tls_certfile and tls_keyfile is used to set up ssl certs in apache and
these variables are not required in the base class but used by the api
class.

Change-Id: If7ac460ee1783f8816250484611269794fc8fc2f

Wait we have an issue with py27...

```
Failed to import test module: oslo_messaging.tests.drivers.test_impl_rabbit
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/hberaud/dev/redhat/upstream/openstack/oslo/oslo.messaging/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/unittest2/loader.py", line 456, in _find_test_path
    module = self._get_module_from_name(name)
  File "/home/hberaud/dev/redhat/upstream/openstack/oslo/oslo.messaging/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/unittest2/loader.py", line 395, in _get_module_from_name
    __import__(name)
  File "oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py", line 31, in <module>
    from oslo_messaging._drivers import impl_rabbit as rabbit_driver
  File "oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py", line 29, in <module>
    from amqp import exceptions as amqp_exec
ImportError: cannot import name exceptions
```

I think that the version of amqp in use here is not compatible with py27 and we need more work on this patch to support py27.

We need to rethink how to catch this exception and see which exception  we can expect in the case of py27.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-08-25 09:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Wait we have an issue with py27...
 > 
 > ```

 > Traceback (most recent call last):
 > File "/home/hberaud/dev/redhat/upstream/openstack/oslo/oslo.messaging/.tox/py27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/unittest2/loader.py",

 > File "oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py", line 31,
 > in <module>
 > from oslo_messaging._drivers import impl_rabbit as rabbit_driver
 > File "oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py", line 29, in <module>
 > from amqp import exceptions as amqp_exec
 > ImportError: cannot import name exceptions
 > ```
 > 
 > I think that the version of amqp in use here is not compatible with
 > py27 and we need more work on this patch to support py27.
 > 
 > We need to rethink how to catch this exception and see which
 > exception  we can expect in the case of py27.

I wondering why we can't import amqp's exceptions with py2.7

I did some tests locally (directly on the py-amqp repository) against py-amqp 2.5.2 [1] with py2.7, and I can't reproduce the issue.

```
$ git checkout -b 2.5.2 2.5.2
$ python2.7 -m virtualenv .venv
$ source .venv/bin/activate
$ python setup.py develop
$ python2.7                                 
Python 2.7.17 (default, Oct 21 2019, 17:19:01) 
[GCC 8.3.1 20190223 (Red Hat 8.3.1-2)] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from amqp import exceptions
>>> dir(exceptions)
['AMQPDeprecationWarning', 'AMQPError', 'AMQPNotImplementedError', 'AccessRefused', 'Blocked', 'ChannelError', 'ChannelNotOpen', 'ConnectionError', 'ConnectionForced', 'ConsumerCancelled', 'ContentTooLarge', 'ERROR_MAP', 'FrameError', 'FrameSyntaxError', 'InternalError', 'InvalidCommand', 'InvalidPath', 'IrrecoverableChannelError', 'IrrecoverableConnectionError', 'METHOD_NAME_MAP', 'MessageNacked', 'NoConsumers', 'NotAllowed', 'NotFound', 'PreconditionFailed', 'RecoverableChannelError', 'RecoverableConnectionError', 'ResourceError', 'ResourceLocked', 'UnexpectedFrame', '__all__', '__builtins__', '__doc__', '__file__', '__name__', '__package__', '_method_id', '_method_name', 'absolute_import', 'error_for_code', 'pack', 'python_2_unicode_compatible', 'unicode_literals', 'unpack']
>>> 
```

Previously we didn't seen that on ussuri and master because py2.7 support have been dropped.

[1] https://github.com/celery/py-amqp/releases/tag/2.5.2'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2020-10-10 02:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-08-30 15:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Restored'}, {'account_id': 29071, 'date': '2021-08-30 15:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-02 06:09:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This is still weird. We haven't figured out *why* this is failing in Python 2.7 but not Python 3.x. We should get to the bottom of that first and add a NOTE in the commit message explaining why the diff is necessary (assuming it even is)"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:18:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

> This is still weird. We haven't figured out *why* this is failing in Python 2.7 but not Python 3.x. We should get to the bottom of that first and add a NOTE in the commit message explaining why the diff is necessary (assuming it even is)

Okay, turns out this was because of the broken import system in Python 2.7. That would have been tough to figure out had I not seen it before. This is resolved now with a note added."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-09-02 16:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

top-level 'amqp' module. Thank God for Python 3.x, eh?

commit_message:
Catch ConnectionForced Exception

Occasionally I saw large number of connectionforced exceptions.
such exceptions cannot be healed automatically and requires a reboot.
catch it and ensure connection established.

Changes:
  oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

NOTE(stephenfin): We need to add the 'absolute_import' future to disable
the legacy import flow. Without this, the import of 'amqp.exceptions' in
'oslo_messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit' attempts to import 'exceptions'
from the sibling module, 'oslo_messaging._drivers.amqp', instead of the
top-level 'amqp' module. Thank God for Python 3.x, eh? More information
is available at [1], for those curious enough.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/q/33743880/

Change-Id: I5c468d10230f05438df780e045f1e92662edf070
Closes-Bug: #1883038
(cherry picked from commit 26e8bb4cc9097fddf3c2e34599b131e3f5d73867)
(cherry picked from commit 360deb89a7e95d332267564b486219e389a793f7)

commit_message:
Refactor orders cleanup

This patch continues the refactor of cleanup logic.  It adds a
new `cleanup()` method to the order client that attempts to delete
all orders and all screts created by those orders on cleanup.

This patch also adds some scaffolding to the Container client that
will be fleshed out in a follow-up patch.

Change-Id: I78d875980637e82ddc3173aad2fc7ecf4941230c

commit_message:
Do not test service_user parameters directly

The service_user parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::service_user resource type. Thus we should
avoid testing parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource
type can cause test failures.

Change-Id: Idc1324b4eb683a0ec0e57e20bca25238149adb0f

commit_message:
Do not test authtoken parameters directly

The authtoken parameters are not managed directly but managed by
the keystone::resource::authtoken class. Thus we should avoid testing
parameters directly otherwise any change in the resource type can
cause test failures.

Change-Id: I04286fac26f1f8787a3eb1304fc689d304ba5d50

commit_message:
Use a 'params' hash for authtoken parameters

This change adds the 'params' hash in authtoken class, to implement
the same functionality as the one recently introduced into
puppet-nova[1].

[1] 5c38281e1b698f157f03bf1815733277c541c30b

Change-Id: Id291959862bfe82cc1800e9bc7759b52006a10b7

commit_message:
[func test] move unshelve test to the proper place

When unshelve after shelve offloading with qos port got supported in
I678722b3cf295c89110967d5ad8c0c964df4cb42 I forgot to move the
related non offloading test case from the test class containing the
unsupported case to the other test class containing the supported
cases. This is fixed now.

blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate
Change-Id: I20a9767c6b75ce6a40aec8ae4876838bba5221e5

'}, {'created': '2021-04-15 12:32:41.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Make external ports aware of network AZs

This patch adds support for Network Availability Zones in ML2/OVN.

For normal instances (without external ports) ML2/OVN does not need
to be aware of the network availability zones because the DHCP server
is distributed (ovn-controller servers DHCP locally to the instances)
and we do not have a DHCP agent.

But, we do have the concept of "external" ports that are ports that are
scheduled on a different node than the one that the instance is running.
Right now, the only use we have for external ports is for the SR-IOV use
case but, it can and will be extended in the future for other uses such
as native (without the use of the DHCP agent) baremetal provisioning.

With this patch we no longer create a single HA Chassis Group to
accomodate all the external ports, instead, the ML2/OVN driver now will
create a HA Chassis Group per network and the members of this HCG will
be Chassis that matches the Availability Zones Hints specified in the
Neutron network object (if not specified, all gateway chassis are added
to the group). With this, external ports created for this network are now
scheduled only on Chassis belonging to the AZs from the parent network
of this port.

As stated above, this patch also removes a limitation that we had for
the SR-IOV case where all SR-IOV (a.k.a external) ports were scheduled
on a single gateway node because, prior to this work there was only a
single HA Chassis Group created which included all gateway chassis in
it.

Documentation will be added on a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I9a655e5b9085e9ac6b23ad7479d442ec4ccbcf37
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Make external ports aware of network AZs

This patch adds support for Network Availability Zones in ML2/OVN.

For normal instances (without external ports) ML2/OVN does not need
to be aware of the network availability zones because the DHCP server
is distributed (ovn-controller servers DHCP locally to the instances)
and we do not have a DHCP agent.

But, we do have the concept of "external" ports that are ports that are
scheduled on a different node than the one that the instance is running.
Right now, the only use we have for external ports is for the SR-IOV use
case but, it can and will be extended in the future for other uses such
as native (without the use of the DHCP agent) baremetal provisioning.

With this patch we no longer create a single HA Chassis Group to
accomodate all the external ports, instead, the ML2/OVN driver now will
create a HA Chassis Group per network and the members of this HCG will
be Chassis that matches the Availability Zones Hints specified in the
Neutron network object (if not specified, all gateway chassis are added
to the group). With this, external ports created for this network are now
scheduled only on Chassis belonging to the AZs from the parent network
of this port.

As stated above, this patch also removes a limitation that we had for
the SR-IOV case where all SR-IOV (a.k.a external) ports were scheduled
on a single gateway node because, prior to this work there was only a
single HA Chassis Group created which included all gateway chassis in
it.

Documentation will be added on a follow up patch.

Change-Id: I9a655e5b9085e9ac6b23ad7479d442ec4ccbcf37
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
compute: Add support for microversion 2.89

This microversion drops the duplicate ``id`` field while adding
``attachment_id`` and ``bdm_uuid`` to the output of the
os-volume_attachments API reflected within osc by the ``openstack server
volume list $server``command.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/804275
Change-Id: I8a7002d8d65d7795e106b768df868198ab8b8143

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for metadef APIs

This commit updates the policies for metadef APIs to be default role
and scope aware if ``enforce_new_policies`` option is set to True.

NOTE:
Glance is implementing Secure RBAC as EXPERIMENTAL in Wallaby, so to
enable it operator needs to set ``enforce_new_policies`` to True along
with ``enforce_new_defaults`` of section ``oslo_policy`` to True in
glance-api.conf file.

Implements: blueprint secure-rbac
Change-Id: I33809f5fde7dd60b27156866744d2a06facd416d

commit_message:
API v2.45, adds metadata support to access rules

Added access metadata for share access and also introduced the GET /share-access-rules API.
The prior API to retrieve access rules will not work with API version >=2.45

Closes-Bug: #1920687
Change-Id: Iec3a3fad5e2bdf854f04ae974248d899f90bd894

commit_message:
Create /etc/cni/net.d if it does not exist

With podman 3.3 /etc/cni/net.d is not shipped by default on new
installations (it is only kept around when upgrading rpms. See
[1] for reference).

To avoid the following error we just make sure it exists at all times:
2021-09-01 11:21:36.206658 | 52540091-d4aa-1b13-79a6-000000000a52 |      FATAL | Update default network configuration if possible | undercloud-0 | error={"changed": false, "checksum": "ece5f2caab61ae83ae546c73ae36f95ff219a2c8", "msg": "Destination directory /etc/cni/net.d does not exist"}

Tested on centos9:
2021-09-01 14:11:05.023124 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a51 |       TASK | Delete legacy cni0 interface (podman < 1.6)
2021-09-01 14:11:05.047931 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a51 |    SKIPPED | Delete legacy cni0 interface (podman < 1.6) | undercloud-0^[[0m
2021-09-01 14:11:05.048606 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a51 |     TIMING | tripleo_podman : Delete legacy cni0 interface (podman < 1.6) | undercloud-0 | 0:01:53.699516 | 0.02s^[[0m
2021-09-01 14:11:05.064588 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a53 |       TASK | Make sure /etc/cni/net.d folder exists
2021-09-01 14:11:05.236680 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a53 |    CHANGED | Make sure /etc/cni/net.d folder exists | undercloud-0^[[0m
2021-09-01 14:11:05.237553 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a53 |     TIMING | tripleo_podman : Make sure /etc/cni/net.d folder exists | undercloud-0 | 0:01:53.888439 | 0.17s^[[0m
2021-09-01 14:11:05.253416 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a54 |       TASK | Update default network configuration if possible
2021-09-01 14:11:05.594105 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a54 |    CHANGED | Update default network configuration if possible | undercloud-0^[[0m
2021-09-01 14:11:05.594957 | 52540007-257c-e8fb-c605-000000000a54 |     TIMING | tripleo_podman : Update default network configuration if possible | undercloud-0 | 0:01:54.245866 | 0.34s^[[0m

[1] https://git.centos.org/rpms/podman/c/89639c19dfff7506d6fd9e3c828026f2b91725d1?branch=c8s-stream-rhel8

Change-Id: I264624683ef8d8c279073ac820ed73b13dd0f2b5
(cherry picked from commit dee317e454f0c512de4f3919f7225c6408f536f4)

commit_message:
Implement OSC share instance export location commands

In this patch we add openstack commands for:
- share instance export location show
- share instance export location list

Co-authored-by: Eduardo Santos <eduardo.experimental@gmail.com>
Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: Ic1b5616a363059a941caa3cce6bd2b24bd379068

commit_message:
OSC Implementation for Share Networks

Add the following OSC commands:

 share network create
 share network list
 share network show
 share network set
 share network unset
 share network delete

Partially-implements: bp openstack-client-support
Change-Id: I6ddb2fec1d9421bfa8b11c82da5379ada80f610b
Co-Authored-By: Vida Haririan <vhariria@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

subject: Remove unnecessary workaround for missing ipmitool dependency
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-08-27 03:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-08-28 00:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-08-31 12:08:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nThis patch is okay the way it's justified, but I also think it's taking the wrong path in the grand scheme of universe. Puppet should do what I've implemented in Bifrost https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/src/branch/master/playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/hw_types.yml and figure out dependencies based on what is enabled rather than relying on the packaging pulling in everything. That being said, the way things are now, this patch is correct."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-02 15:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Remove unnecessary workaround for missing ipmitool dependency

... because the dependency was already added in UCA[1].

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cloud-archive/+bug/1572800

Change-Id: I5c09ddee31f04df51a47d47d41c4d91505a7d5d4

commit_message:
Use a 'params' hash for authtoken parameters

This change adds the 'params' hash in authtoken class, to implement
the same functionality as the one recently introduced into
puppet-nova[1].

[1] 5c38281e1b698f157f03bf1815733277c541c30b

commit_message:
Actually close the connection in Connection.stop()

Although we were stopping the connection thread, we never actually
close the Idl's connection to ovsdb-server. This is especially
noticeable in neutron's "short-lived" connections for ensuring the
creation of the pg_drop Port_Group which happen pre-fork and so
the sockets are getting cloned after the fork since they are still
open.

Closes-Bug: #1929119
Change-Id: I8a57c73f20a299b811ee31b55d40a76de9deb1cd
(cherry picked from commit cde7c1f7d4e39d2f02c689037a3d373fb67fd278)

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
messages: [{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-09-02 17:49:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 17:03:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifbeb3db08c6e93388d3e3b3e0853b1f7303c1785
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifbeb3db08c6e93388d3e3b3e0853b1f7303c1785

commit_message:
[SVF] Manage GMCV volumes on separate pools

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Providing support to IBM Storwize cinder
driver to manage GMCV change volumes on a separate child pool while
primary and auxiliary volumes remain on the specified storage pool.

Implements: blueprint ibm-svf-gmcv-childpool
Change-Id: I29432986531678c533bc6b45e8bd1f7a35469ebe

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I75945a8c3b0303db8392ec2fcc9b920a1b16a62a

commit_message:
Allow for a more permissible regex

Some openstack installations use characters that are not in \w, the
old regex, now moved to string2hash was more permissible, and
there's probably no reason the regex in pythondict2hash can't be
just as permissible.

Change-Id: I35b964d96e6a558f1a10daa2391a398db60ea800
(cherry picked from commit 7111aa75f98b9038824d2a47e36dfd6d5043c80e)
(cherry picked from commit 7ff77f8225f3974c04fdb6f3a9a6ddd2ff8a926a)
(cherry picked from commit 99f8e1b4589be7e0930a44af8e374cadc01ccbc7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-30 13:32:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove local apache2 install, rework use_swift

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

Change-Id: I6519b1449806ad19ee4545501bc4631c9f8e535f
'}, {'created': '2021-08-30 17:43:30.000000000', 'message': 'Remove local apache2 install, rework use_swift

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

Closes-Bug: #1942047
Closes-Bug: #1934563
Closes-Bug: #1938069

Change-Id: I6519b1449806ad19ee4545501bc4631c9f8e535f

If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are

maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is

Closes-Bug: #1942047

'}, {'created': '2021-09-02 14:36:10.000000000', 'message': 'Remove local apache2 install, rework use_swift

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

This change also makes test bundles use ceph as a storage medium for
glance since out of space errors were encountered during testing as the
glance unit was running out of space for image storage.

Closes-Bug: #1942047
Closes-Bug: #1934563
Closes-Bug: #1938069

Change-Id: I6519b1449806ad19ee4545501bc4631c9f8e535f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove local apache2 install, rework use_swift

The functionality of use_swift where a local apache2 instance was set up
for metadata was deprecated for removal and this change actually removes
this. However, the option itself can still be used as an indicator
whether Swift is intended to be used for simplestreams metadata or not.
If the usage is explicitly requested, the charm but Swift endpoints are
not yet present, the charm will now will set the unit state to
maintenance in addition to local logging that was done previously.

Swift presence checking is now endpoint-based instead of being
service-based (no use for the case where endpoints are not set up while
the service is in the catalog).

The lack of swift presence is also ignored for the purposes of
generating proxy setting context - if the endpoint is not there there is
not point in trying to generate NO_PROXY rules for it.

This change also makes test bundles use ceph as a storage medium for
glance since out of space errors were encountered during testing as the
glance unit was running out of space for image storage.

Closes-Bug: #1942047
Closes-Bug: #1934563
Closes-Bug: #1938069

Change-Id: I6519b1449806ad19ee4545501bc4631c9f8e535f

commit_message:
Improve content of FloatingIP AFTER callbacks

Use same FIP field names for all notifications.
Move association_event field into Payload metadata.

Closes-Bug: #1933502
Change-Id: Ia462ca4b340cd3d9a27341632b24926c3290a4b2

commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt value after first newline character

Passing newline to the dnsmasq may cause security issues, especially
that in case of Neutron that dhcp options' values are controlled by
cloud users.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's values before passing them to dnsmasq.

Closes-Bug: #1939733
Change-Id: Ifeaf258f0b5ea86f25620ac4116d618980a7272e
(cherry picked from commit df891f0593d234e01f27d7c0376d9702e178ecfb)

commit_message:
Remove puppet-python

puppet-python has been used by only puppet-monasca. However
puppet-monasca has been already retired thus the module is no longer
required.

Change-Id: I2f0749b087168a9a7f820ee708fbe65113e015bd
